He also left me do the right amount of exploring with the trucks electronics without hovering.   The finance manager did a great job explaining my options for extended services and warranties.   This was the BEST car buying experience I have had in 30+ years.   I recommend AutoNation Ford in Westlake.   Remember to ask for Hans!!

Chris Kline
Medina OH

So I have used a few different air duct cleaning services and I was concerned about not having some guy with an oversized shopvac  show up to my house to clean the ducts. I bought a house that was an animal hoarder and the vents just looks nasty please refer to my pictures before and after Kim is a  amazing answered all my questions assured me that the job would be done in a timely manner as it was the guys showed up they were professional and very detail oriented. explaining the process as they went. I rarely give five stars on here but I just had to this is an amazing company very thorough

Great options for food. Food tasted great. Portions were small plate worthy and not too small. Got the tater tots, egg rolls, lobster nachos, cheese plate and vegetable fajita tacos. We left full but not crazy stuffed. Definitely recommend going on a Sunday during all day happy hour for select food and drinks.

I'm not normally a person crap on a store. I go into Walgreens several times a weeek, for mess, etcetera. Jennifer in the pharmacy (really good pharmacy). I pick up a gallon, of milk, Handed to my kid and she ste dropped  evrtytgibg. 
Three we're several women, Doris, who has the nastiest mug in Cleveland. She never has smiled at a customer ever,  but I saw her face as she laugh at me ( let's say cackle.)
 I think the manager, Bob tried, but they were backlatlking, and generally refused to do anything but stand in the cooler, laughing at everything.

Very mod mex here. Not your typical dive Mexican joint with plastic covered menus and order by number choices. Nice enough to bring a new date to or your mother-in-law. (If you like her!) 

At the upper end price wise for Mexican and drinks, but in line with other Crocker Park venues. 

Thursday is ladies Margherita night! So bring on those Tequila lov'n babes. And my wine snobby girlfriend was even happy. So the wine list has to be good.  But no mole Otherwise very solid.

Nice place inside. Called ahead for Sunday appointments and was told no reservations or holds on Sundays. So we came in and had a group and was made to feel like were inconveniencing them. Then two women walk in and they are taken ahead of our group. Interesting. Then manager comes to tell us we don't take reservation and several ahead of us and when I asked why the two women went ahead and he said oh we take special request for our regulars.... Anyway not cool. The feel of this manager turned to nice after we spoke but still shady. pricey for services and one person in my group got a simple manicure for $42, so because had gel polish it went from $18 to $42??? and then another went home with nail polish smeared cause tech loaded up on her feet and even tho dried it was so heavy it smeared hours later. As for myself an extra $8 for a lotion he said would cure cracked heels...... that's comical. So $50 pedicure. So my advice is check your bill and confirm the service and price before service is given cause you will probably be surprised and also when they say no reservation they mean reservation for "good clients" only. Bad policy. I'll send myself and friends elsewhere!

Our go-to Mexican place for about 5 years now. Fast service, great frozen margaritas, good food and kid-friendly. The staff is so friendly and accommodating, we compare all other Mexican restaurants to this place and none come even close to Don Ramon. It's also very clean. So happy this place is close to home!
Hands down the best la fitness in the Cleveland area. So many hot, rich dads. I suggest going around 5pm because that is prime dilf time.

Not impressed by the dealership. Walked around dealership for about 10 minutes before anyone even noticed me. Then their selection was crap! The salesperson kept trying to put me in cheap BMWs that I didn't even want! They don't even know how to listen to customers! No wonder the dealership is empty.

Holy happy hour!! One of the best happy hours in town. The place is the cutest cozy little cabin in the and in the middle of Westlake and feels like a mini escape from the world. Very quaint. I've only been for happy hour on Sunday (from 4-9) and you can't beat it! Shrimp and grits and a steak are on the HH menu and so are dirty martinis (WITH blue cheese olives.) Sunday funday anyone?!?!?!?

ordered 1st beer,waitress came back,said out of stock.ordered next favorite,same reply,ordered 3rd favorite...same reply.finally got what I wanted on 4th request.when it came to dinner,brought out 1 meal; not mine,she explained mine got burnt& was being made again.once all was made good,food & service was fine

Great food, great atmosphere, but every now an then your waiting awhile for your waitress after your seated and thy get your bill wrong, and you wait ten more minutes for your drinks, but it's pretty good all around, except for the service.

You've heard it before and I'll say it again: Vanilla bean apple pie bacon milkshake with a shot of bourbon.  GTFO.  I am sad that they got rid of their Reuben burger because I thought it was phenomenal.  As a substitute I opt for the Lola because I love a fried egg on top of just about anything, or the Kojak, which has gyro meat, if I'm feeling squirrely.  Truthfully, all of the burgers there are great.  The meat is juicy and flavorful and the buns are always soft and fresh.  They do offer more than just burgers.  They have fried bologna, chicken wings and brats.   I got the fondue once and I don't see myself ordering it again in the future.  It wasn't bad necessarily, but I could still taste the rosemary the next day.  I kid you not, it was insane.  They have an awesome beer list and a wide variety of booze drinks, lots of whiskeys, which I appreciate immensely.  Every time I've been there the service has been courteous and fast.  The biggest problem I have with this place is the cubby hole of an entrance way that gets backed up during peak hours, or at any time there are more than 6 people waiting for a table.  My boyfriend is a burger freak and he has stated many times to me that B Spot's are his favorite.  I suppose it is a little pricey considering the burgers come solo, but that's why i docked them a star.

Originally I really liked Tina's. I would come when I couldn't get in at my normal spot or needed something real quick. I soon learned however that they're very sloppy with their work. And they're EXPENSIVE. 

Also, I've seen the owner Tina be really rude to customers on multiple occasions. Sigh. That was my last straw. Maybe I would still come here for a pedi if I was in a rush because it's so close to my house but other than that I think my relationship with Tina's needs to be done.
Family got sick!  Bad chicken.  I actually called and spoke to the manager and his response was, couldn't be our chicken...what??  Would not recommend.

Get the Top Shelf Guacamole and ask for Sean. He's a masterful "mixologist" of the best Guac ever!!!! He worked so well with this group of "mexicanos"to craft it to our specific tastes! Emily was the best server and kept the drinks, the food and the smiles coming! Great food  great staff!

Burgers ok. We had the Lola, the fun guy, and the porky burgers and a basket of onion rings. My bun was covered in butter and greasy to hold. Didn't eat the bread. For dessert we shared the chocolate shake with coffee liqueur and vanilla bead apple bacon bourbon shakes. The shakes pushed it to 4 stars.

I wanted to get one last glass of wine before leaving to go home for the night with my boyfriend. So when I saw the wine bar by the Apple store, it was a no-brainer. Walking in, I saw a sign instructing us to seat ourselves. The decor was really nice, dim lighting with high wooden ceilings. It was relaxing and cozy and I was super excited to snag a couch in the far corner of the room. We sat down and our waitress, a girl with long straight dark hair, came to give us our menus, she asked if we saw a checkbook lying around the couch or tables and we all took a quick look around and couldn't find anything. She left so we could peruse the menu. Since I just wanted a drink, I picked one out fairly quickly. My boyfriend doesn't drink so he was quite happy with the surprisingly delicious cucumber water. 

When our waitress came back, I ordered my drink. She had this expression on her face that made me feel uncomfortable, as if she was annoyed with me for only ordering a drink and nothing else. I have a pet peeve about that sort of thing, and seeing that the restaurant was not crowded in the least bit- there were several empty tables- it wasn't like I was "stealing" a table from a potential big spender who'd would have to give her a big tip. So already, my visit had an awkward start. 

Feeling unnerved, I felt like I had to order something to appease our waitress so I ordered some Old School Tots when she came back with my drink. I wasn't hungry in the least bit and was in no mood to order a $10 appetizer so yes, I ordered the lowest priced vegetarian option I could find. She gave me the same annoyed expression and this time, my boyfriend noticed there was some subtle hostility. Then, a couple other waiters and I think, the general manager, came back over to us three separate times trying to find the missing check book. At one point, my boyfriend was on the floor using a flashlight on his iPhone to help look, and no one apologized for disrupting our night. I felt bad about the missing check book, we had not seen it at all during our entire visit, but the lack of communication between all the servers was seriously getting on our nerves by then. At one point, I had wondered if they thought that WE had taken the check book.

Not surprisingly, our waitress had completely forgotten to bring us our appetizer. The whole night, we could clearly see her over by the kitchen chatting with one of the guys behind the kitchen counter and ignoring us. By the time she finally came over to ask us if "everything was okay," it had been 30 minutes, my wine was nearly gone and I had given up on the tots. We just asked for the check only to be kept waiting for another 20 minutes. Finally, she came close to our table to clean up someone else's table and my boyfriend had to call across to her for the check a second time. We wasted no time paying and getting the heck out of there.

I was very disappointed because the wine bar seemed like it had a lot of potential. I know the main problem was the service, so I do plan on coming back another time and giving it another chance with a different server.

I have been coming to B-Spot since they opened once or twice a year. Tonight was culinary perfection. I got The Clevelander, bratwurst,coleslaw, and French fries on a pretzel roll. This bratwurst was the best I have ever had. This was in fact the best sandwich I have ever eaten. I added items from the pickle bar to spice the sandwich up further. Service and atmosphere was great. Chef Michael Symon continues to impress.

Crocker Park is full of great places to eat and this place should make your list of "next to try". If you are in to hot dogs and sausages, they have you covered. The menu has some really great twists on old traditional foods. 

Staff is great and the laid back setting lends well to hanging out with friends and grabbing food. On nice days, sit outside and enjoy some people watching with your beer. Kid friendly with plenty of options to cater to a picky eater. 

Facility is clean and obviously well managed.

L-O-V-E this place.  I could live off of froyo.  I first met froyo when I lived in NYC and was introduced to Pinkberry.  Then I moved to middle-of-nowhere Maryland and went over a year without true froyo.  When I first moved to Cleveland, a coworker brought me to Swirl, and froyo and I were reunited.  But then Swirl's quality went downhill, and I was again deprived of froyo.  Enter Spoon Me.  

Spoon Me is better than any other froyo experience I've had.  Tons of flavors to choose from (all of them tart!  None of that crappy, fake sweet garbage) with a great assortment of toppings.  My favorite will always be the original (why mess with perfection?) but I do try other varieties from time to time.  Most recently I sampled the Apple Pie which was spot-on and the Pumpkin, which wasn't so great (tart and pumpkin just don't go well together). 

As Rachel B. mentioned, a huge perk of froyo is how healthy it is.  Very low in calories, zero fat, and all of the health benefits of yogurt.  If you've never tried froyo in its true form, you need to get out from that rock you're living under and give Spoon Me a try!
Stopped here for appetizers and drinks after work. Great location in the middle of Crocker Park. I liked the food, good atmosphere, and friendly service.
Katie is the absolute best. So thorough! She makes sure to get absolutely every hair and even does clean up strips to make sure. She makes it as painless as possible and guides your breathing.

B Spot: Well if you knew this location before it was Agave, which is a perfect location for B spot! It is very noisy and busy, so you will be screaming or shouting with your guests.

Pros:  Food is amazing, try something new, my personal favorite is the Yo! Burger.  Fun and friendly staff.

Cons:  There is no room in the restaurant! It used to be a lot bigger when it was Agave.  You will have to wait anywhere from 45 mins to 2 hours, so be READY!  My food was under cooked, but staff was to busy to care.

All in all:  1st time at B Spot (eaton) was amazing, this was my 2nd time at B Spot, and it is starting to lose it's sizzle.

Needed John 3 different times in the last 1.5 months.  One visit was for a hot water tank that he put as much priority on as if it was his own need.  Response and punctuality always amazing - also, fast work.  Pricing was also awesome (can't think of a better word right now) - well below what typical places would charge.  John is more knowledgeable than anyone and takes the time to explain what is best and offers sound suggestions.  He is also really nice and friendly.  If you want great work from someone you can trust (across-the-board-on everything, believe me) - call John at All Star Affordable Plumbing!

The food is almost always good. But for some reason we always get the same server and he always has his mind elsewhere. He takes FOREVER to do anything, eventually someone brings up a our food. And we got double charged last time we were there.

Great place for good food, excellent music, and great beer. We had the Fat Doug (burger, cheese, cole slaw and pastrami), the Shroomage (mushrooms and cheese), onion rings, and the house made chips and fondue.

The Pat LaFrieda's burger mix was juicy and flavorful, the burgers cooked to perfection (one medium rare, the other medium well). The onion rings were large and went great with the six sauces provided (the Balsamic Steak Sauce might have been our favorite).

Piped in music was mostly 70s and right in our wheelhouse. Beer selection was excellent, about 20 drafts all laid out by type of beer. Service was friendly and helpful.

Located at Crocker Park which is a nice shopping and residential area. B Spot was very busy when I went during black Friday. Its a Michael Symon restaurant so thought I'd check it out. It has a good atmosphere and seems like a popular restaurant. Fortunately, we were seated immediately on arrival.

Ordered pulled pork sandwich. None of the burgers or sandwiches come with fries so had to order separately. Honestly, its just a regular old burger and beer place. Pulled pork wasn't that special. Everything was a little pricey. They do have a good beer selection. Not the best burger joint Ive been to.

Went twice this week, service at the bar and in the restaurant were both outstanding, I forget the bartender's name but my server was Ryan and he was on point, suggestions and attentiveness. Sit at the bar, they give complimentary pork rinds. They go really well with the selection of house made sauces. Free pickle bar!!! Onion rings and fries were perfect and don't be afraid to order the bologna, it's almost an inch thick!

I don't see what the big deal is. Kind of expensive. I had both the Cracker Park and the one in Weaks-ville. I prefer the Annex Burger in Solon. I like dumpy places where hillbillys gather. The Annex Bar in Solon is such a place. Buckeye Beer Engine in Lakewood makes good burgers. I try to stay away from red meat though. Is the B Spot a play on the G Spot? Does the G Spot exist? Is this a place where gangsters gather? I think that South Central is the best gangster/hood movie ever. Menace II Society had terrible characters and I could care less if any of them died. If I do ever come out with a burger place called G Spot, I will call the best burger the "OG Bobby Johnson" in tribute to the lead character in South Central.

I'm so happy with LA Fitness in comparison to other gyms. 

Firstly, the atmosphere is airy, bright, spacious, chilly (which will become irrelevant once you get to working out), and despite what I hear everyone complaining about, it's clean to me.

The equiptment is plentiful and diverse, from treadmills to ellipticals to boxing bags. They also have a decent sized lap pool, sauna, and showers. 

The workout classes are great. I like abs plus core with Heather and Spinning with Amber. I always feel sore afterwards!

Lastly, they don't really have a dress code and I know this may be unimportant to most people, but I like to wear sports bras and crop tops (tasteful, and ment to be worn by themselves) while working out because it helps motivate and make me feel confident when I work out. So, I appreciate not getting harrassed by the gym about my attire.

Writing after two visits.
The food is generally good. I was little hesitant with the 4 stars but decided to go ahead with it.
First time we were in a group so I had chance to sample variety of food. Everything was spot on. The portions, the flavors and taste.  The home made tomatillo salsa is amazing. It is so hot that it is good. Without burning my taste buds.
The second time though, the food was salty.  The beans the fajitas as well as the rice.  Of course saltiness depends on the individual palate but I found it a heavy on salt.
The service is good. People are friendly, serve with a smile.  Prompt.
The place is huge.  Lots of booth and table seating.
Ask for their tomatillo salsa!!!!!

This is one amazing place to have before we leave town. I got the hamburger with bacon, onion and mayo with cayenne fries. My wife got the chicken quesadilla. Both of these meals were very delicious. I really hope one of these come to our neighborhood. I wanna eat there again very soon.
Excellent food. Excellent mixed drinks (Long Island ice tea is what I had). Service is very good. Guacamole cart well done. Overall, I'd come here again. Best in awhile.

Soo we were hesitant about this place as a friend of mine wasn't a fan, but we tried anyway and soo thrilled we did! Cute place, friendly staff, no wait. The complimentary salsa & chips were different and so yummy! The fresh guac was also delicious!! I ordered the Colada & mojito and both were amazing! (& I'm particular about drinks) steak tacos & traditional hard tacos were bomb. Honestly! I was nervous for the green rice but it was also so good!! We can't wait to go back!!

While my purchasing experience was good, I recently had an unpleasant experience with the service department.  After 2 days holding my car and not having anything done except for reading the error codes (which I did myself in 5 minutes), I demanded that I pick up my car because there are things I can do with my CUV that I can't in a loaner 3 series sedan--and the problem wasn't urgent.  Although they were not happy with my decision, they grudgingly said they would get my car ready.  Low and behold, I go to pick up my car, sit in the driver's seat and stare at a new 15" long crack in the windshield!!!  This is a 2015 X1 and I baby this car!  Luckily, I did not even drive this car from the lot and called the service manager to come take a look.  He tells me to call in the morning.

Long story short... The service advisor that I dealt with denies any responsibility on behalf of the dealership.  Then I talk to the service manager who also denies responsibility.  All the while, I am treated by these two on the phone like some sort of criminal who is trying to scam them.  They conjecture that there was a crack there previously or that a pre-existing crack extended itself.  The fact remains that there was no crack in the windshield when I dropped the car off and a 15" crack is present when I pick the car up.  Finally, the service manager does agree to have the windshield replaced.  Am I happy?  No, I'd rather have my un-cracked original BMW windshield rather than a non-OEM replacement that seems to make excessive noise on the highway.  No, I'd rather have been treated like a valueable customer than a shady scam artist. 

In the end, you decide where you buy your vehicle and where you take your vehicle for servicing.  Although BMW tries to limit any competition for their cars by region, you still have a choice.  Choose wisely!

Great hotel!  Stephen and everyone else we encountered at the front desk were super friendly and helpful.  The lobby and room were pretty.  Beds and pillows were really comfortable.  Room really quiet.  The coffee is really good for a hotel, especially the robust.

Only wish the room had a comfy chair to relax in and a refrigerator.
What a fantastic job they do! I was thoroughly impressed as everything was flawless. They were friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. I highly recommend!

This place ticked off all the boxes for our party of 5:
* Clean -- extremely so. Still feels "new" a year after opening.
* Comfortable -- our room was great in every respect.
* Convenient -- 15 minutes from Cleveland -- great place for families to stay when visiting Cedar Point, Rock and Roll HOF or Cleveland Indians.
* Rates -- very reasonable. We paid under $150 per night after taxes.
* Pool + hot tub -- both were roomy and clean. Bonus points for fun kiddie pool area.
* Hot breakfast (free) -- lots of options to satisfy everyone in our party. 24-hour coffee a plus.
* Neighborhood: Crocker Park shopping/dining district is about a mile away with lots of choices. (We chose B Spot and loved it.)

Pro tip: Late August, when Ohio schools are in session, seems to be a sweet spot for out-of-state travelers like us.

The after "love to eat turkey" place to come during the holiday weekend.  Meeting friends here for the Thanksgiving weekend rounds.  I made my rsvp for table of 6 on opentable.com.  Worked like a charm.  The outside is nice with a classy look.  The restaurant looks like it is part of any office building so if you don't see the sign you may miss it.  We started at the bar.  Every bar stool was filled with some hightop tables.  It wasn't a problem since we were being seated right away.  We ordered drinks and Calamari.  Calamari was prepared well with a sweet and tangy twist to it.  I ordered Tilapia, my wife ordered the surf and turf burger, had turtle cheesecake for dessert.  Everything was very good, cooked to perfection, and high end restaurant worthy.  Service was great but our entrees came out slow.  It took almost an hour for it to come out.  If we weren't all talking and catching up someone may have complained about it.  If I noticed, I'm sure others in our party did.   They have a lounge/niteclub on the lower level.  There was a strange smell that everyone in our party mentioned.  It smelled like sewer gases or something like that.  The live entertainment was good.  The atmosphere was great except for that smell.  One thing that I was annoyed a little by was that the server lost my credit card when cashing out my tab.  We found it on the floor after a couple minutes.  It wasn't a big deal but if they would have lost my credit card it would have turned me off enough to not come back or give negative reviews of the place.  I know this place is newer and going through some growing pains but if it doesn't address some basic issues it may crash before it launches.  I would definitely come back again for dinner and drinks.

Recently moved to Crocker and sadly Trader Joe's does not carry everything for a complete grocery run. I'll admit I have shopped this Giant Eagle several times even though each time has been more disappointing than the last, but it's close so sometimes it works (occasionally to pick up bottled water). Let me start off by asking if anyone else has noticed this horrid smell upon entering? Disgusting. Staff have been continuously rude especially at the service desk which is laughable. I have celiac disease which means gluten is not apart of my diet. Not a big deal these days since grocery stores are very accommodating especially the last few years. Well this last visit to the ever so stinky Giant Eagle was definitely my last. 

Prior to entering the store there were no less than 7 employees smoking at the designated smoking area in front of the store. I realize this is where they are allowed to smoke, but nevertheless its disgusting. I usually bring my toddler son along on my walks around Crocker so naturally I walked to the opposite side of the smokers and explained to my son why. Upon doing so I was called a stuck up B (by one of the employees)! This was not the only less than stellar language I heard while walking past the employees. Some were in dust covered aprons which I imagine means they work in the bakery? Again, just an assumption, but once again DISGUSTING! 

At this point I really considered walking past and going straight to five guys, but I really just wanted a GF pizza. So I went against my best judgement and walked into Giant Eagle. Upon entering I noticed my beloved gluten free section has been replaced by various beers and booze. Fine. Where is the gluten free section these days? One employee inquired "well what are you looking for? Cake?" Haha. Not a single employee knew where I could find gluten free food as they are remodeling. That's fine. Sometimes there is chaos during a remodel. I get it. What I don't get is how I went through the entire store and found one tiny freezer section of frozen waffles, a couple loafs of bread, and a few frozen dinners. Oh, and there was one pizza among the gluten pizzas. 

So in closing I want to thank Giant Eagle for being transparent with their employee smoking policy or lack there of. I also want to thank them for continuing to allow their store to smell like a public restroom. From a family who spends $600+ a week on groceries we WILL NOT be back. Luckily Fresh Thyme just opened and their employees are so friendly and helpful. Oh and their store doesn't smell awful upon entering!

Wonderful as always!! Lobster bisque was delicious, steak seasoned well and cooked perfectly. Creamed corn was fantastic(one of the few things we haven't tried). Creme brûlée was perfect end to the meal. Service is incredible every time. Can not wait for our next trip!

Finally a Holiday Inn Express that looks like a modern hotel! Still has the same lackluster breakfast but the hotel itself and rooms are nice. Plenty of space in the room and the television was nice and big. The room workspace had a pull-out table on wheels that was convenient and spacious. IHG, model your other HI Express hotels after this one!

Service department was dismissive and rude. Headlight on a brand new car went out and the service team doesn't have time to even hear about it.  Told me it would be 12 hrs to fix, which seems unreasonably high and was probably just a ploy to make it ok to not do it today.  

Sad that BMW doesn't audit this place and shut it down. Totally under represents the brand.

We dropped into 87 West 2 today for lunch. What a surprise! It's a small place right in front of Dick's Sporting Goods in Crocker Park (not our favorite destination by any means). They opened in March 2008. The concept is really great. They have an extensive menu of wines by the glass, lots of inventive and delicious-sounding cocktails, many small to medium plates to snack on, comfy seating areas with sofas and little tables, outdoor areas, fireplaces in and outside. There is an open kitchen so you can see the chefs working if you care to. The bar has five or six seats, and there is also a narrow bar-type counter in front of the kitchen so you can get up close. We started with a bottle of Chardonnay and had a "Winter vegetable roll". It was essentially a rice paper roll filled with julienned root vegetables and deep green salad greens. There were edible flower petals in that roll, too. Very refreshing and light. The plates were very well presented. There was an orangey dipping sauce. Piquant. It was a fun way to eat a salad. Then we shared a small plate of artichoke hearts stuffed with asiago cheese and coated with panko crumbs. This was served on micro greens with a variety of dipping sauces. Very tasty. At this point, feeling happy, we decided to try the "wine flight" concept. In the center of the room are two cruvinet-type wine storage/dispensing machines. You buy a card loaded with how many dollars you want to load it with, get glasses from the server or bartender,  go over and choose whatever wine you want from the display, put your preloaded card into the slot,  place your empty wine glass under the chosen spigot and press the button. Voila! Two ounces of wine in your glass. If you want more, just press the button again and you will be rewarded. It's a great way to try wines you've never had before from many regions and of varying price ranges. If you like the wine, you can choose to order that by the bottle or the glass as well. Two ounces is not much. We were still in snacking mode, so we had a tuna "poke", which was a martini-glass shaped vessel embedded in ice and filled with seared rare ahi tuna layered with "Poke" seasonings and avocado. This came with very thin flatbread pieces. Yummy as all get out. Poke is a traditional Hawaiian dish, and this was a faithful version of that. We could have gone on and on, as every single menu item sounded delightful. Grilled cheese sandwiches, short ribs, cedar salmon, lots of different cheeses, lobster nachos, crab and lobster bisque, desserts and so on. It's a neat concept because you can eat as much or as little as you like, and you can eat as healthily or as decadently as you like. Everyone was friendly and smiling. 
Update: we went back. We decided not to do the "wine flight machine" again; it was decidedly fun, but pricey. If you are dying to taste a certain wine without making a major commitment, it may be a good way to go, but ordering by the bottle or glass is more practical. We sat at the bar again, and we had a different experience this time. The food was good, but our perception of the place changed dramatically because the bartender had the personality of the proverbial wet noodle. This can really put a pall on the "fun quotient" wherever you go. If you're hungry you will end up spending a lot of money. The small-plate prices add up quickly. We also tried sitting at various other places in the room, and it became apparent that all you could do at the "comfy sofa areas" is drink, because the tables are much too small to hold anything other than beverages. 
Update: We went again, got a fun server/bartender, and had another good experience. The food is solidly delicious. The last few times we've been by at lunch time, however, they haven't been open.

I recently joined due to their 4th of July sale and I have no complaints! The facility is well maintained and the staff is very kind. The hours are very reasonable and there is an extensive list of fitness classes that are included in the monthly membership cost. I have no complaints!

Came to Cleveland this past weekend and we loved the place! Great burgers, atmosphere, and new age bathrooms. Had trouble turning the sink off, but the wall of vintage beer cans was cool! It is located next to the Champps in the Westlake Mall.

I bought my 2007 3 series here, and a year later came back and traded it in for a 2014 3 series. Howard Schneider is an amazing salesman. He is very laid back and understanding of my car needs. I've had amazing experiences with the service department as well. The only problem is they always give me a great loaner when I take my car in for service, that's how I ended up with the 2014. I would highly recommend BMW of Westlake. Once you purchase a car the dealership invites you to some amazing events. I recently drove their whole fleet on an autocross and was one of the first people to drive the i3 and brand new 7 series. 

I highly recommend BMW of Westlake and Howard Schneider personally. You won't be disappointed if you purchase with him.

Ate there last week.  Big disappointment.  Prices are up, specials are basically gone.  Food was mediocre and overpriced.  They took a lot of items off their menu that I liked in the past.  This place has had a lot of ups and downs over the past 20 years.  We ate there a lot in the past 2 years and it was very good. But now they're definitely in a downward spiral.  We'll try again in a year or two.

As a longtime burger conoisseur, i've been to the much heralded B-Spot a few times in the past, but this time was the last!  The place has progressively gotten worse over the years.  Case in point.  I took my wife and daughter there tonight, after my little girl had a visit and photo op with the Crocker Park Santa.  We were all in a great mood, until I bit into bony gristle in my cheeseburger, not once, but twice!  Disgusting!  Spitting a mouthful of bread and meat out into my paper towel napkin must have been quite the unpleasant sight for my family and nearby patrons!  The burger also seemed dry and much less flavorful than during my previous visits.  In addition, they got rid of the chili cheese fries (I knew this from previous visits, but never mentioned it online), and the coffee was too strong.  We ordered the regular fries, and the server brought them to our table in a large metal container, with fries falling out all over the table.  The fries themselves were of the super thin variety, which reminded me of McDonald's or other fast food fries!  They were unimpressive in the taste department.  Also, the men's room has no paper towels, which I needed to open the door handle while exiting, so I don't get any bacteria or viruses on my hands before handling my burger!  I don't mind the hand air drying part, but having no paper towels is ridiculous.  What added insult to injury was the ridiculously high bill of around fifty dollars (excluding tip) for a party of 2 adults and a child, for a gourmet burger experience that was dissapointing.  Sorry B-Spot, but you have been dethroned by the much better, tastier 'The Rail' in North Olmsted.  I've been there a few times lately, and B-Spot doesn't compare!

B spot is a great place to go if you want a really good burger. My husband and I have been to B Spot about 6 times in the last few weeks. Now our reasoning is mostly unrelated to the food, we are Kentucky fans and found that every time we ate there throughout the NCAA tournament, we won. It is definitley not a sports bar atmosphere but B Spot burgers and Mary the bartender were our good luck charm! The service at the bar is fantastic (a 5/5). 

We have tried most things on the menu, all of the burgers are great with the porky being my husband's favorite. Always ask for the Smasher's special as it is usually something really interesting! I would steer clear of their turkey burger, it isnt bad, there are just way too many other options that are better. We happened to be there a lot during lent this year and were really impressed with the fish sandwich! I wish it could stay on the menu all year! They have a pretty good beer selection and a lot of different boubons which is great for us Kentuckians. The only negative I have is that they are a little overpriced for burgers, expect to spend about $50 for two people if you both order a sandwich, fries and craft beer.

I love don ramon is the best Mexican restaurant on town  best Mexican restaurant on town food is delicious drinks great en very good price and service is very good and fast  margaritas and excellent service

I've heard great things about this place.  I've tried giving them the benefit of doubt, so I've been here 3 times...but NO MORE!  They remove my shellac polish with their own fingernails...disgusting! Sitting at the filthy table, the manicurist used a nail file to remove the debris from the previous client by scraping the table with it and then proceeded to use that to file my nails.  Their people skills do not exist.  I have been a manager in a reputable salon and I do not know how the health department has not shut this place down.  Support local and USA!

Thanks,Chad, for bringing the car right to my home for the test drive. Frankly, I otherwise would not have considered going to the West side.  Although I have been driving Audi for 10 years, fell in love with the BMW.  You expressed a true passion for BMW through your detailed knowledge of the car and the engineering and benefits of its features.

This cantina is awesome! The food is freshly prepared and it truly shows. Instead of your normal salsa, theirs is smoky and semi sweet, a nice change. The atmosphere is open and spacious filled with life and light. Laura our server was especially nice. She is knowledgeable and real when talking about the food. She really shows how much she enjoys the restaurant. We didn't order the guacamole, but we will next time we visit. It is freshly made right at your table. Can't wait to go back.

Sweet, tart, and frozen. Not just like frozen yogurt, but the "real" frozen custard with that sour taste. Spoon Me is like Pinkberry for the common man who doesn't want their frozen yogurt weighed on a scale while being eye-assaulted by modern neon housewares and useless gadgets. 

Spoon Me has a ton more flavors than most places like this (which usually just have a "plain" and one other flavor). They had at least four or five flavors, including milk chocolate, acai berry, and pumpkin. But I should suggest that the tart quality of the yogurt lends itself better to berry flavors, or those without extra sweetness, because it ends up tasting  a bit sour (I felt this way when I tasted the milk chocolate flavor). Also, there are plenty of toppings to choose from at 50 cents each, ranging from healthy (fresh fruit) to indulgent (lots of different candy toppings).

Their "baby" size, the smallest, is really enough and is only around $2.50. But this yogurt is so good that I could definitely eat much more than that! 

Bonus: Fat Free and only 83 calories per serving.

This is the only place I will wash my vehicle.  It's nice and clean.  They offer 3 self wash bays, and also have an automatic car wash bay for those that don't want to do it themselves.

What really separates this car wash from others is that they have one of the best auto detailing centers in the CLE area.  With that, and the fact that it's in an affluent neighborhood, you won't find garbage all over the place from other people who "cleaned" their cars and missed the trash can.

The staff on hand is very friendly and helpful, and will go out of their way to make sure that their equipment is functioning properly.

Oh, and most importantly the change machines actually work.  Can't say that about most other places.

Horizon did an amazing job on our landscape lighting. They were professional, detail oriented and were patient with us when we kept on asking for changes. My neighbors are all jealous and our house is definitely the envy of the neighborhood now. Thanks Horizon.

Dinner with the family. Place was supper packed but we were seated within 5 min. Waitress was quick to serve and awesome. Food was delicious!! Atmosphere was great. They have a bar were you can mingle, chat and have a cold one. Highly recommended!!
This place makes some of the best chicken noodle soup I have had! There beef tacos are the business! And service couldn't be better! You must try.

On May 9th I left my car while I went on vacation giving them time to fix the issues I was having. I got a call 2 days later saying it was fixed. I have a noise coming from the rear of the car that I drove with the Service Manager so he could hear it. He heard the noise and assured me they would fix it. The technician determined the noise was my licence cover which it wasnt. I picked the car up and the noise is still there maybe even worse. I called in to talk to Bridget and she told me I had to come back in and waste time I didnt have because the service manager did not drive my car after the supposed fix. I am upset at this whole situation because I do not have the time to sit there while they try and pin point the noise. I offered to leave the car but I need a rental because I have to get to work and I was told thats not an option. I gave plenty of time to have the car fixed the first time and it wasnt. I have left 3 messages for the service manager to call me and he has not. This experience has made me think twice of re leasing with Autonation and taking my car to this dealer.

I went here with the highest of hopes, considering it is owned by Chef Michael Symon. But, it was meh. Don't get me wrong. The burger _was_ tasty. I had the Inferno burger and it did have a kick. However, the "rosemary fries" for 3.99 were both overpriced and ordinary, and the milkshake was just a milkshake. I did like the special sauces on the table to go with the fries though. Would I eat here again...maybe, but I have had better burger meals at Red Robin.

Sorry Chef Symon, I have to give you a B-.

Michael Symon's concept in First Energy stadium and the Q is a fraud.  The food is the same price as the restaurants yet not nearly the same. The chick magnet is a shell of itself with about 10% of the chicken and on a stale bun.   They misrepresent the menu and con you into thinking you are getting the same food as normal but you are not.  Stay away!

I've been getting mani/pedis with my mom, who is a serial nail spa shopper, since I was a young kid and I can honestly say this is by far the nicest, most luxurious nail spa I've ever been to. Honestly reading the reviews and seeing the pictures, I was worried it was going to be out of my budget! The best part is, it's not even at a premium upcharged price. 

I had Keno as my tech, couldn't have been more pleased. I take my beauty regiment people seriously, and as someone who gets nervous choosing new people for repeat, somewhat intimate type services, he was everything I look for: professional but can read a client to know he can relax and be personable and candid, made
me feel comfortable, excellent work that I was extremely happy with, and efficient and quick but without rushing through. 

Did I mention ya'll, fully stocked bar with a free drink if you get their top level (~$50) pedi? HELL YEAH. FYI, my top level pedi with gel mani, plus one additional drink came out to a very reasonable $106; lesser services can be had for nothing more than you'd pay at a strip mall joint, and given the wonderful atmosphere here I don't see any reason to return to those. I've convinced my mom and grandma to follow me on pictures alone.

B Spot: My first experience with the culinary greatness that is Michael Symon. This restaurant is fun & exciting-from the garage doors that open to the street to the beer cans that form a giant "B" on the wall. 

We came on a Thursday night and had to wait about 30 minutes to get seated. Our server, Jackie greeted us warmly-I immediately felt comfortable. After talking about Chicago and chatting it up with the ever so amazing Jackie, we ordered our food.

Since all food comes to your table at once, we got: 
-porky fries: lola fries covered in jalapenos, cheese & pulled pork(YUM!)
-The hotty bratwurst: loaded with banana peppers, jalapenos & Symon's signature "shasha" sauce. Perfection.
-The Fat Doug burger: set atop an amazing bun with pastrami, coleslaw & swiss cheese. divine.
-We somehow also got convinced into ordering a milshake-the apple bacon milshake to be exact. Wow. The little bits of bacon were sometimes a little too chewy, but the shake was creamy & rich. 

B Spot is a definitey "to-do" while in the Cleveland area. So happy I was able to visit it on my roadtrip to Cleveland.
Great food. Yummy Casa Rita. Marvelous chips and salsa. Chicken enchilada wonderous. Rice and beans magical.

After an oil change my wife's car died on the hi way after some time she was towed back to the dealer, an after some more time Rachel the service manager told us that a bug in the wire harness had made the car die on the road, after asking to have something in writing to support the finding the other service manager became Angry and raised his voice and said he would charge us for the tow very unprofessional and made us feel that we did something wrong . They definitely need work on customer service think twice .

I can't believe they treated us this way in service, especially after how nice the sales people were while shopping for new cars.

Our week old, third BMW got a broken windshield. We were told that we could pay $70 to fix the windshield instead of the $100 deductable to replace the windshield, suggested by Brittany. We chose this, but it left behind unsightly scars on the week old car. Now I feel foolish for the charge to leave scratches, which were a surprise when we picked it up. Then the story was that the purpose was only to prevent expansion, not to clean it up. So then she said to call the insurance company. When we did, she and the agent argued over the rates. Then while I was talking to the agent, she basically sent us away because she said they wouldn't pay enough - even though we were on the phone. We thought this was very rude, including the way she talked - particularly as the insurance company said they would try to work it.

This turns me off from buying and recommending BMWs.

The shame is that this dealer is 3 minutes from our home, but now we feel we have to go to other dealers for all future business.

Ok, being from California I didn't think I would ever find Dollar Pints.  They have them here.  Wen't here on a whim, doesn't look like much from the outside and is your typical Bar on the inside.  Pool tables in back some Pub tables and a Bar in front with a small stage for I am assumiung local bands.  We went on a Friday night and it was a very good time.  They had Kareoke and an awesome mix of people.  Just an all around fun atmosphere.  Even it was our first time there it didn't seem like it.  We felt welcomed and had a great time the Staff was friendly and even when it got really packed they always made it around to the table.  We will definately be going back.

I don't drink at all, but I love to eat, so it speaks volumes that I would love this bar! Both my husband and I had a hard time choosing what we wanted as an entree due to all the great choices, but I went with the taco Mac n cheese bake. Sooooo good and hearty, and no way I could eat it all. Very shareable. My husband had the Philly cheese wrap with the onion straws and tator tots but only could eat half though he loved it. We had the Hooley Hunks with tarot tots as an appetizer and those were juicy. Can't wait to come back and bring our daughter. Kid and family friendly too.

Fantastic burger & onion rings and shake!

We were out shopping in Crocker park one day and are fairly new to the area. We dropped into the B&N and asked the cashier where to find a burger, she pointed us to the B spot...

It took about 15 minutes to seat us because they were so busy, but they move quickly. It's a casual place so there's picnic tables, paper towels on the table and concrete floors.

The menu is straight forward and the beer is a plenty :-)

My husband and I settled on each of us having a Lola burger each medium-rare, fries, onion rings and cider beer.... 

The burgers were juicy and flavorful, I loved the marinated onions. The battered onion rings were tasty. My husband's only complaint was he didn't care for the shoe string fries...would rather have thicker hand cut...but that's just a preference, nice flavor though...

Even though we had gorged ourselves, my husband insisted on trying a shake. We were not disappointed. 

We shared the vanilla apple pie bacon shake...as he likes to say "everything goes with bacon"... We will be returning and working our way through the menu :-)
Amazing customer service! I've gone through the good people here especially Diana Tait for my last two cars and they've taken great care of me

Good vibe here, good drinks.

Had a horrible experience with my waitress though. She tried to double charge us for drinks, ordered us the wrong queso, got my order wrong (I wanted Cheese Enchiladas, but Chicken showed up).  The incorrect order was fine.  She also wrote everything down.  Maybe she was having a bad day or maybe she can't read - seriously. Not joking.  

Even though service wasn't good - the food was good - so I will come back, knowing what to expect.

I discovered Rometrics salon through Groupon about 3 weeks before my vacation. I normally go to a long hair specialty salon, however with a vacation coming up I wanted to try to save a little bit of money. So when I saw a Groupon for the salon, and saw it had pretty decent reviews I decided to give it a try.

The first issue came when I tried to book my appointment via the Yelp app. At the top of their page there was a link that offered you to book your appointment online. I did so and booked for a cut. Later upon realizing that my Groupon was for a cut and deep conditioning treatment I contacted the salon via email asking if I needed to add additional time to the appointment for the deep conditioning treatment. When the salon called me back they told me they had no record of my appointment. They asked how I booked and I informed them through the Yelp app. They told me they did not offer any type of online booking, and did not have an appointment for me, but offered to book the appointment at that time. They didn't apologize for the confusion, and acted like I was just making it up, but you can clearly see where it says 'Book An Appointment' on the page. I also read them the confirmation email I received, and they said they "don't do that" and didn't know where that came from. I'm just glad I contacted them or else I would have walked in with no appointment. 

My appointment was on a Thursday afternoon with a stylist named Meg C. Meg did a thorough consultation and was polite and friendly. She cut my hair and gave me a curled round brushed blowout (which is how I mentioned to her that I like to wear my hair.) I suppose the error was both of our fault since I should have asked her to style it straight, that way she could have checked the cut afterwards. However, because she round brushed it out and it was curled she was unable (as was I) to see where the cut was very blunt in the back and the layers a little shorter on one side. 

I called the salon later that evening after I ironed out my hair and saw the error, and some rude girl begrudgingly offered to book me an appointment on Saturday morning with Meg again. On Friday after looking at my cut more closely I realized that I was really unhappy with it. I called the salon and asked to speak to a manager, and asked her if there was someone else who could fix my hair who is more experienced with long hair. (The reason I asked this was because I considered maybe long hair just wasn't her thing. As a former hairdresser myself I know we all have have our favorite things to do.) The manager I spoke to was very rude and basically told me she didn't believe me that my cut was uneven. She told me she was "shocked" and that Meg was their "best stylist," and that Meg is the one who does her hair. She told me there was really no one else she could recommend since Meg was their best stylist. She also said that since I came in with a Groupon that my hair could only be fixed by another girl who takes Groupons. 

I thought that was a little bit ridiculous and realized at that point that the salon really doesn't care about client retention. Typically when you go back for a redo they will bump you up to a higher level stylist to ensure your cut is satisfactory, and to try to keep you as a client. The manager pretty much left me no real option, and so I told her it was fine I would go back and see Meg, and that if they really thought she was the best stylist then I felt confident trusting her to fix the cut- especially because I know even the best stylists have an off haircut every once in a while. However, I was still pretty annoyed that the manager didn't believe me (even after I offered to come back to the salon right then to show her my hair just to prove to her what I was saying), nor did she apologize, and was just completely unhelpful.

I went back in on Saturday morning and Meg fixed my hair, no problem. It took less than 15 mins, she was polite and friendly, and I tipped her again. After she said goodbye the girl sitting behind the desk (Kayla?) w/ reddish purple hair smugly asks, "Are you happy with your hair now?" I told her yes, it was an easy fix, and walked out. 

I will definitely not return to the salon again. Meg wasn't a horrible stylist, and I would probably trust her to cut my hair again. She was never rude to me, and I saw several other nice stylists working. But the rest of the staff had horrible stink faces on, every person I spoke to on the phone was rude, and the treatment from the "manager" was unacceptable. In the future I would much rather cough up the $75 for my other stylist, because saving the money was not worth all of this. It's unfortunate when an otherwise decent stylist loses a potential long term client because of the lack of professionalism from other team members. I honestly would not recommend this salon.

Ive purchased and leased many BMW's over the years. My purchasing experience here was what I have come to expect from BMW dealers. Courteous, helpful and easy. 

But its AFTER the sale where a dealership is really put to the test. And that is where BMW of Westlake has failed miserably.

 Everything I paid for or was promised during the sales process has been almost impossible to get. I paid for an extended warranty that took over 6 months of repeated phone calls and emails to get completed. They took my money at the time of sale and did nothing for months. Now a year and a half after I bought my car I got a nail in my tire and the dealership by my home told me I have no warranty on the wheels and tires. I was told when I bought the car it had the wheel and tire coverage until 2018. 

I have send several emails and made phone calls to resolve this and have gotten zero response from anyone who can help me. So its the same thing over again that I delt with the first time. No interest in assisting with follow through.

So if you plan on purchasing from here beware they have no back end  follow through here. They are only concerned with getting the sale and what happens after that is not anything they care about. 

My sales person Tom was a great guy, but the fact he works for such a un-reputable dealership means my next BMW will surely be purchased somewhere else.

Salon is very nice and well kept. Went to Katie for the first time who was very nice, but not for the long hair loving customer. She cut off quite a bit more than I asked for (specified by landmark). If you're conservative with your hair changes I wouldn't recommend. 

One overall thought on the salon is if you're cautious to trust a hairdresser who looks like they rolled out of bed... it might not be the place for you

So very disappointed in our visit this evening.   We were a group of 40 who had a choice of 5 menu items and alerted the restaurant of the choices before our reservation tonight, so everything should have been ready for us.  There were 5 tables and our table happened to be in the middle so we were told that we would have 2 servers so they could split the room.  That didn't happen, so our table was treated like the red headed step-child.   Our group started arriving at 5:30 and the last people showed at 6:00.   At 6:20, we still didn't have a server to take our drink order.   Finally, when drinks arrived, 2 people got Long Island iced teas and they were vastly different.   One was loaded with Coca-Cola and the other wasn't.   We were brought a plate of bread and butter at 6:30.  Once everyone took a piece, there were 2 left.   We asked for more bread, waited awhile and nothing happened.   Our salads finally came in an awkward way, with one server delivering salads and the other handing out small containers of salad dressing.  The salad was just bagged salad with one cherry tomato and one slice of cucumber.  We again asked for bread, so our server (Mary) walked over to another table and asked if they were going to eat their bread and since they said no, she brought it to us.   Do I need to say HEALTH CODE VIOLATION?  We couldn't believe it.

Food finally started coming out, and of course all other tables were half done eating before ours came out.  5 people at our table had steak and the server didn't know how the steaks were cooked and just started handing them out.   One guest had prepared her baked potato with butter and sour cream, and then cut her steak and ate a piece and said that it was well done and she wanted medium.   The server took her plate to the other end of the table and told that guest that they needed to switch plates.  When told about the potato, she took a fork and picked up the steak and told the guest to switch it with the other one.   OMG! I can't believe this happened in a restaurant.  My salmon was bland, the vegetables were stone cold and the baked potato was only warmish.  My husband had ordered the pork chop and his meal wasn't delivered until we were 80% done with our meals.   We twice asked the server where his meal was and instead of being apologetic, she announced that it wasn't her fault,  but the kitchens fault.  Again, OMG, this isn't really happening.  

We asked if there were any dessert choices because we weren't offered any as they just brought our check.   Our server yelled over to the other server to tell us the desserts.   They clearly didn't want us to order dessert, coffee, or drinks.   Who does that???????

My husband had enough and went and spoke to the manager, who apologized, recognized there were health code violations and said he would talk to the server.   To top it all off, there was a mandatory gratuity.  This server deserved nothing with her awful attitude and service.  The manager would do nothing for us and has totally lost any future business from us, our family and friends, as we will be sure to spread the word.

Run away as fast as you can.

Edit:  Just received word that this is the location where Michael Symon is opening his new B-Spot.  Very excited to have this at Crocker.  

I ate there only once and it is not a favorite.  

Food Rating 1
Margaritas 4
Service 3
Ambiance 3
Cost 3

There are much better places to eat at Crocker Park.  I might go back if it is just for drinks but never again for the food.

Why the low rating? I don't know where to begin. My wife and I joined a group in our community who once a month organize a dinner at a different restaurant. We know, from both personal and professional experience, that large group dining is a challenge for restaurants and those dining. We recognize that the service may be a little slower than normal and there can be confusion. To mitigate this, as it often the case for large group dining, our group of nearly 30 pre-ordered our entrées from a selection of four items.

Seated at a table of 8, as luck would have, it we were the last to place drink orders and to confirm our entrée orders. When (almost) all of the entrées at our table were served, the kitchen failed to mark the temperatures on each of the steak entrées. When one person cut their steak and took a bite she told our server that steak was cooked to a medium well temp and she ordered medium. Another person at our table cut her steak and said that it was cooked medium and not medium well. 

RATHER THAN TAKE BOTH PATRONS PLATES BACK TO THE KITCHEN AND WITHOUT DISCUSSION, THE SERVER PULLED THE PLATE OUT FROM UNDER THE FORMER PERSON, TOOK IT TO THE LATTER PERSON AND USED THE PATRON'S FORK TO SWITCH STEAKS!!! 

AFTER HAVING REQUESTED MORE BREAD TWICE, WITH NONE DELIVERED, WE REMINDED OUR SERVER, AT WHICH POINT SHE WENT TO ANOTHER TABLE AND ASKED IF THEY NEEDED THEIR UNEATEN BREAD AND SET DOWN AT OUR TABLE!! 

THAT IS TWO STATE HEALTH CODE VIOLATIONS!! 

Oh, and my entrée was only delivered after everyone in our entire group had eaten half of their meal. My vegetables were cold and the baked potato was half cooked. When I expressed my dissatisfaction to my server she uttered not a word of apology, but rather said "this is not my fault, it is the kitchen's fault." 

To add insult to injury, there was an automatic gratuity of 15% added to the bill!,

When I brought all this to the attention to the manager his reply was that he was very upset by the actions of the server and that he would deal with it. However, he did not so much as to even offer to waive the gratuity charge!
It is a chain and that is about it. It is standard. Borders is out of business so not much left in competition. Location is nice and good collection of music and DVDs.
Nice healthy breakfast options. A few ingredient changes in the past two years that were not for the better, but the staff is absolutely AMAZING.

Stopped here for a quick travel break and oh my! Great sorbets and ice creams. I missed the Specials board so while I was happy with my Key Lime Pie/Raspberry sorbet combo, I regret missing out on the lavender honey ice cream and the lemon blackberry frozen yogurt.  Next time I'm road tripping through Cleveland, I'll make up for it!

We went to BiryaniHut (newly opened in Westlake) for the first time today and were favorably impressed with the food and service. It is a no frills restaurant (not much in terms of ambience) but the food was wholesome and tasty. We ordered the vegetarian and non vegetarian thali's (complete platters) which came with a vegetarian appetizer, a curry dish, dal (lentils) naan and Biryani (house specialty). The non veg platter had the same types of dishes, but made with chicken. The biryanis were extremely tasty and were in ample proportions. You can ask for the spice level to be adjusted based on your spice tolerance. We asked for medium and it still had a nice kick to it. The service was friendly and the restaurant is clean. We would surely go again and recommend it to friends.

I sometimes reward myself for getting out of bed early on Saturdays or Sundays with a breakfast trip to First Watch--which is to say that I really don't go to First Watch all that often.  I've never waited there when there are crowds (and it does get crowded during weekend brunch times).  While the waiting area looks comfortable enough with free coffee and big couches, Brio and Cheesecake Factory are alternatives with substantially more dining space.

The dining room, while your basic diner, exudes a sunny and pleasant atmosphere.  There is free wi-fi, but you have to access it through a splash screen and login.

I think the main advantage First Watch has over the other Crocker Park brunch locales are the healthier options available.  I enjoy the Tri-Athelete Omelet, and there is also the Oatmeal if you're looking for something even lighter.  I haven't had much of the lunch/sandwich fare--if only First Watch were open for dinner.
This is the best Indian food I've ever had. It tasted to me like what I imagine Indian home cooking to taste like. It was so fresh and delicious!

I want to amend my previous review. I have since been back and I must say the food and the service us vastly improved. Kudos to the management and the staff for a better dining experience.  Our meal was back to abide part, service was fast and efficient.  Not to long of a wait for a Sunday.  Very pleased.

I ordered  the Lobster Roll and New England Clam Chowder.

The lobster roll was decent, as the other reviewer mentioned it has a lot of imitation crab meat and not enough lobster. the sauce is good but a bit overwhelming.

The clam chowder was what I was most excited for and I'm definitely disappointed. For a seafood shop I expected better, it was reheated (I should have known better from the other reviews). The clams were not fresh (maybe because it was microwaved), and the soup was way too watery.

I wanted this place to be good but unfortunately it doesn't measure up.

Not bad, not great... average 

The staff is really nice, and I will probably go back. However after reading the reviews, expected to be wowed.

Hands down, best ice-cream I haver ever tasted. Like, seriously. In fact, I'm thinking of relocating to Cleveland just to be closer to this gem. Again, seriously! 

My boyfriend and I stopped by as an impromptu visit, and boy, are we glad that we did! The shop was clean, bright and smelled devine as we walked in. Smelled like freshly baked cones and hints of nutty aromas. 

I got the toasted pistachio and he got the pralines in cream. As much as I love my pistachio and that's usually the flavor I almost always get, his pralines in cream was out of this world. I am most certainly getting that next time I stop in!! And to top it off we both got them in waffle cones which I highly suggest because they tasted so fresh and yummy and delicious and decadent and I can go on and on! 

The price for the two single scoops in waffle cones came to a smidge under $10. Well worth it, my friends. Well worth it indeed. Thumbs up, Mitchell's!!! We are customers for life!!

Love First Watch! I have been here numerous times. Mostly for breakfast but a few times for lunch. Their menu has such a good variety of options. I always have a hard time narrowing it down to just one thing. Love the Eggs Benedict Florentine. The service is always good even though they are always pretty packed. Love the location in Crocker Park. It is fun to breakfast here then head next door to Trader Joe's. Highly recommend.

Absolutely terrible customer service.  I brought him a suit to have tailored, because he was supposed to be the best in town.  He measured me up, sent me on my way, and said he would call the following week when it was ready.  He never called.  A week and a half later I called and he said it had been ready for awhile....

I arrive to pick it up and try it on.  The waist was far too big, and he had to take in another 2 inches.  He said he couldn't have that done for a few days.  

I return again to pick up my (hopefully) finished suit.  Try it on again and the pants are too long, and he gets very upset.  He tells me I'm wasting his time with this "cheap $400 suit I brought him" and he wants to be done with me.  I calmly explain that I would rather not have come 3 times myself and simply would like the tailoring done correctly.  He continues to fume while remeasuring the pants and barks at me that he will do it now so we can be finished.

I have been to many tailors and they all ask for feedback while deciding on how much to take in a jacket, how long you'd like the pants, etc.  Giovanni, in his infinite pretentiousness asked for no feedback and tailored the suit as he wanted.  Why would I give direction to a master tailor?  It has to come out perfect, as this is his craft.  Simply put, he left the pants too long and waste too large, but was furious that I inconvenienced him, by asking him to finish the job I paid almost $100 for.

The suit was a $1,400 Hugo Boss suit, that he was so quick to look down his nose at.  
Deplorable.  I'm sure he can make you an amazing $4-10k suit, but I hope you'll consider who you're spending that type of money with, before you do.
Awesome ice cream, great service, I love the flavors. Cannot go wrong with something different and some fresh whipped cream.

Another wonderful dish I decided to try the blackened mahi mahi with a Cajun crab sauce. One word, delicious. The west suburbs of Cleveland have no shortage of great places to eat and this is one of the best don't miss out on this locally owned gems.

Horrible customer service!  My mother took her car there for brakes and has had nothing but problems with them ever since.  They told her this week that her car needed new calipers.  She went to the Luxus dealership for a second opinion.  Turns out she didn't need calipers at all!!!!!!!  If I could give them zero stars I would.


Follow up... none of the $800 worth of the repairs that my mother was quoted were done and her car is fixed.  The Lexus dealership simply changed the substandard brakes that were installed by Conrad's.  I can't express enough how disappointed I am by Conrad's.  Our family has taken all of our vehicles there for years.
Best Ice Cream ever.  Period.
I adore this place. The staff is super friendly, the food is superb and they recently spiced up their decor, very retro ish. We come here a lot and will be for years to come :)

A few weeks ago my wife and I made a rare visit to Crocker Park (we live on the far east side in Solon) to do some Christmas shopping.  We were going to have dinner at one of the restaurant's there but after returning to our car to store our packages just decided to head home and eat some place closer to home.  On our drive down Crocker to catch I-480 we happen to notice the sign for Daddona's in a small plaza on Crocker.  We knew Jimmy Daddona's (a Solon institution we have been going to for years) had a west side location but did not have a clue where it was.  Since we always enjoyed the food at Jimmy's we decided to pop in and check the place out.

We had planned to just sit at the bar but upon being greeted by the host was informed  that while they had a full liquor license (beer, wine, liquor), they did not have a actual bar.  He suggested a cozy booth near the front, as the booth's in the back of the restaurant were occupied, and it was actually perfect.  It was a bit busy for a Tuesday night (holiday season I guess) with some larger parties.  The host returned quickly with water and mentioned that Mike would be our server, but he was currently occupied with a larger table and that he would be starting us off.  We noticed a Meomi Pinot Noir on the wine list, one are favorites.  We had intended to only get a glass but it was only offered by the bottle so we decided go for it as we were told they could cork it for it if we did not finish.  

While the host went off for our wine we, noticed and observed with a bit of amusement and appreciation the young man who we eventually would find out was our server Mike.   He was occupied with a table of eight about 10 feet from our booth and boy was he occupied.  It looked like the table from  hell; people spoke at him all at once, asking a million questions and asking the same ones over and over as he went around.  Despite this he appeared very pleasant and patient.  Moreover, on a couple of occasions during this theater we were enjoying, he notice us and smiled, mouthing that he would be right with us.  We were having such a good time watching it was no big deal, especially since our wine was brought out promptly by the host.

Mike eventually escaped the table, checked on a couple of his other tables (he seemed to have about 4-5 others) and approached us and apologized for the delay.  It actually had not been that long and in the mean time we had been well taken care of by the host.  Mike ended up being one of the best servers we had at a restaurant in a long time.  Despite the fact he was clearly busy he spent a fair amount of time with us discussing the menu and the two specials offered that evening.  The menu was slightly different from the Solon menu, but all our long time favorites were listed (chicken marsala, the best lasagna in town and the tomato cream pasta with chicken to name a few).  We noticed the west side restaurant had a strip steak listed, prepared a number of ways, which does not appear on the Solon menu.

We decided to take our time and ordered the mussels olio to start as we sipped our wine.  We order mussels all over town, but we always enjoy Daddona's in the olio sauce (which we soup up with their well know garlic rolls) the most.  We know what large portions you get, and we planned to order dessert, so we ended up splitting our entrée (3 dollar plate charge) and ordering an extra salad (one comes with the meal...in fact salads or wedding soup are included with all entrees).  Even though we had just polished off a bowl full of mussels, we could not resist ordering the fruit di mare, an old time favorite of ours, which includes mussels, shrimp and scallops served over linguine in a calm sauce.  It tasted just as good if not better than the Solon restaurant.  Even though the restaurant was busy everything came out timely and Mike checked on us a number of times to make sure everything was alright.

Like I said we ended our meal with the cheese cake (served with a raspberry sauce) we have been chowing down for years in Solon.  We just cannot resist as it simply the best, and as explained by the host who served it (and something we already knew), it is made by the owner's mother.  Things slowed down at this point and Mike was able to chat with us a bit.  We discussed the large table he seemed to be having so much fun with through out the evening (it only got better as the night went on) and we had a couple of good chuckles about the experience, although he was very polite about the table.  If Mike is working I would definitely ask for him if he is available.

Good food, good service...a great family owned reataurant.

Red roof inn- you are like the nerdy guy in English class you mock but secretly appreciate for being dependable and steady.  This is a basic, no frills room.  It is clean and quiet and they allowed my hound to stay with me.  And don't get me started on the Ready Set Go breakfast bags!!!!

Cant find Grandma?  Shes here talking Sarah Palin with her friends.  

No seriously, some of the best people watching right here!  Goods pretty good, too!

I had not been here in a very long time but from what I recall (& do not think my memory is fading) the food in the past was wonderful as was the service.  I went there for the 1st time in a long time this past New Year's Eve (12-31-12) .. I will NEVER return.  Granted they were busy so I did not mind that my reservation for 7pm was pushed back to being seated at nearly 8pm.  I figured we would just be more hungry for good food.  The WonTon soup was TASTELESS .. no seasoning at all .. dishwater probably tasted better (in their defense they took it off the bill) .. we ordered dinner for 3 .. each item took longer than the one b/4 it to arrive at the table & by the time the final dish arrived we were simply no longer interested.  The service was slow & quite rude as well .  Thankfully we had not opted for take out .. several people waiting for take out were there an hour or more .. some walked out .. I wished we did the same .. 50 bucks down the drain!
Guys, if you are pakka hyderabadi and biryani lover, this place is awesome. Give a try you will really love it.
Meh. Average bar with average beer. Food average. I just got nothin much to say. It's not horrible by any means but I mostly stop by out of convenience.

This place is kind of hard to find. It's behind Copper Cup and Moosehead. You have to walk to the back and you'll find the door. The environment is a bar and not so much cafe. It is also pretty dark in there. So, the atmosphere wasn't too great and definitely not family friendly since it's mostly a bar. The service was good, but the food was bad. I got a BLT sandwich with tomato bisque soup. The BLT came out cold and the soup was so salty, I could barely get 5 bites in. The waitress noticed I didn't like it and swapped out my soups which was really nice. I then got country chicken which was eh. It was just bland and mushy. The food was just not good. I don't plan on going back here.
My favorite place to get my ice cream and brownie fix. I love buying their ice cream from the freezer, grabbing some cones and toppings and making my own concoctions at home.

This is your basic Chinese restaurant, sort of looks like a throw back to the 70's, could use some serious updating. That's about all I can say since my lack of competence in design is well known. On to the food, went with a co-worker, ordered wonton soup, a bit salty, steamed dumpling, pretty good, but small in size, compared to what you would typically get.  Egg roll typical which is good. I had the beef chow fun, which is a wide noodle, this was really good, I ate the entire plate, maybe because it really wasn't to large.we had an older Asian lady take our order, she was very nice, could have been the owner. All in all a solid 3 dining experience, just what you would expect.  I would go back because if they can produce it consistently I'm in.

Overall, very good. Have been here many times during all situations- when it's slow, busy, day, night  and never walked away hungry or having a bad experience. I can see how this would not be great choice for vegetarians or those with specialty diets, but if you want a beer and a burger/sandwhich/wrap-- then it's just as expected. Love the patio during the summer nights!

not sure if they are still giving presentations or not as we started not getting our travel rebates toward the end of our first year being a member & then asked for a full refund but suddenly there was no communication from them..  Do not join unless you don't mind parting w/ several grand.  We joined this which went against what I was feeling at the time but thought it would help people we know & for us to go on a trip & save some money.  Should never have done it!!!

Every time that we've been to Mitchell's Homemade Ice Cream its been standing room only.  For good reason, it's amazing!! The ice cream is home made with locally sourced ingredients, locally sourced toppings and whipped cream.  The ice cream is rich, creamy and a scoop is quite healthy. Mitchell's is a phenomenon like no other! The service is quick and friendly.

My husband stayed in town for a funeral. The website pics where not what they depicted. It'll do in a pinch. Could be nicer and it's more like a motel setting.Beds ok but could use more comfort he said. Price is fair.
Hot fudge sundae -- oh my! With homemade whipped cream and salted pecans, nothing could be better! Truly, everything is delicious! I love me some Mitchell's!
Bad from the get go. They were out of several things on the menu, service was non-existent and food was mediocre. The waiter never even refilled our water.

Very disappointed. We had 16 people in our party. We were there on a Sat night 7:45pm. They were not busy. Took us a while to get our drinks. Had to ask for the bread that they give you as a free appetizer. Took for ever to get our food, the food was not hot, half of it was eh ok. The rest was good.
