Going in blind (i.e. without checking Yelp ahead of time) I literally marveled at  the variety of flavors on the menu. Natural, organic and local ingredients? Total score right there. Admittedly, I'm a bit of an ice cream snob.. mainly because I'm very sensitive to artificial flavors. 

Things like real vanilla beans, local honey, fresh fruits and good chocolate get me excited.. and there's an abundance of awesome ingredients here. Usually it sucks to be me as my favorite flavours are a disaster to find, however they have hazelnut ice cream here which I happen to love. 

Without exegeration, this was the best (hazelnut) ice cream I've ever had (& that is a lot, in case you're wondering). I really dislike making the boring drive to Cleveland, but now that there is ice cream at the end of the tunnel I'm better with it. Yeah, I am that easy to pursuade.

This is a fun two-level Barnes and Noble; it's a great place to relax during a long shopping marathon at Crocker Park or find the book or magazine that you want to snatch up! They have a great selection of books and magazines and their sale section is especially awesome.

The cafe leaves a lot to be desired, though. Service there always moves at a glacial pace, which means that mile-long lines form on busy nights. Inevitably, these lines snake through a good bit of the seating area, leaving those who sit there at risk of feeling claustrophobic. Some of the other seats are located near the door, enabling those who sit there to receive frequent blasts of frigid air during the winter or humid air during the summer. I wish there were actually a full-scale Starbucks located in the main section of Crocker Park, not at the edge of the Promenade. 

The prices here tend to be a bit higher for CD's\DVD's than at Borders too. However, the browsing areas are a lot nicer than Borders' browsing areas--I always tend to feel a bit cramped there.

The world of print publications is not dead.  Not even close.  Ok, maybe close, but this Barnes and Noble made me believe again.

Two floors of everything from children's to classics, bags to CD's, educational to trashy.  What a site.

Yes, yes, yes there was a Starbucks in the back as expected.

Upstairs had an amazing children's section and their offering of classic novel collections was something special.

Very open area with lots of room to move, browse, walk and even sit and read for a while.

For a "value-priced" motel/ hotel this property was clean, modern and was NOT worn out which is common for this price range. For the price, it did it's job well. I would stay here again if looking for a value priced room. I would rather be in a Marriott or Courtyard but would have to pay substantially more for that luxury.

I do recommend paying the extra $8 per night for the King bed room with a refrigerator.

We had been looking for a B&N for some time that was comparable to the one we left back home in CA. At least once a month our ritual was to go to B&N and have drinks and pastry in the Starbucks Cafe. We are building a new life here but wanted to bring some familiar enjoyable things back into it. 

This location is the closest to the one on Roseville, CA. It's clean, large, good selection of children's books. The Starbucks Cafe is clean, spacious, and has a good selection of items. 

We have been there twice so far. It's been really nice each time. My only issue is the last time we were there. It was quite noisy. They had a group there performing a play. They were shouting their lines in order to attract more attention. And I have to agree with the other reviewer. I compare the book store to a library. Some noise, sure. But lots of loud noise, please no. There are people reading, browsing, studying. And I'm certain most of us like to do it in peace. 

I was a little disappointed with the selection for adults. But since their childrens section is well stocked, I won't complain. I'm able to pass the love of an actual book and the whole book shopping experience on to the little one, which is the truly important thing. And making memories for her of our B&N/Starbucks rituals.

Service was friendly and timely while stopping in to get a few bagels and coffee as a road trip snack due to missing breakfast that morning.  That's about all you can ask for from a chain restaurant/fast casual. 

If the food is prepared to standard, you can't expect anything else.  No chain will go above and beyond with quality over what they have to do - that's why it is a chain.

I usually go to Borders for magazines, but we stopped in here to buy Look At This F*cking Hipster, the book. It's nice enough. Clean, quiet, nice staff. I still like Borders better. How both of these stores coexist at Crocker is beyond me. 

Note about Crocker Park- this store is in the safe part of this "lifestyle" shopping center. Once you venture down to Dave's Cosmic Subs or Trader Joe's, you take your life into your own hands. That back area is the skid row of Crocker. I have seen people wearing not designer jeans and parking not crossover vehicles in the non valet parking lot. The RTA even stops there for Pete's sake. Please be very careful when venturing to this haven of crime. I suggest having 911 at the ready on the I-Phone. One time some person, who clearly did not have a membership to a Westlake country club, tried to ask me where Cheesecake Factory was. Thank the constitution for my right to defend myself using lethal force.

Although it's not local and it's a chain, this First Watch location is a great place to eat. My fiance and I go about twice a month and not once have we had a bad experience. Keep in mind, it's a small place... BUT you can make a reservation before you leave so that when you get to the restaurant you won't be waiting very long. 
All around: Good place, normal breakfast foods, and it's close to everything.

I went here and used coupons I had. I ordered a crab cake sandwich, fish sandwich, and lobster rolls. The crab cake had wasabi aioli and it was delicious!!!! The fish sandwiches were the best I've ever tasted. And the lobster rolls had alot of lobster in them. I would definitely visit again if I'm ever out that way.

I rarely visit Crocker Park.  My visit to Barnes & Noble today reminded me exactly why. 
I am a 40-year old HIspanic, college-educated, well-spoken female.  However, I look very young for my age and people tend to think I'm still in my 20's.  Maybe they think I'm just a young punk and couldn't possibly afford whatever it is they're selling in their store.  Whenever I visit a store in a dominantly white neighborhood such as this, the white employees tend to look down their noses at me.  Which is exactly what happened to me today.  It's sad that this still happens in 2016, but this happens to me every time I visit Crocker Park.  I just hope I like my new Nook enough to make this trip to B&N worth it.

I don't generally waste calories on desserts that are not chocolate.  In most cases, why bother?  A lot of fruit flavored ice creams are full of ice crystals or fairly flavorless.  Then along came Mitchell's Banana Cream Pie flavor-- smooth banana ice cream with graham cracker crust bits!  Completely worth the calories.

The staff is always really nice, cheerful and helpful.  They have a cool train that runs along the ceiling and crayons and coloring books, as if kids wouldn't be occupied enough by the excellent ice cream.
This is a great place to eat breakfest  or lunch.

This is my home Mitchell's and honestly I could be here every single day. There really is no way you can go wrong here. Sometimes it's busy and there are a lot of tweens around but honestly when I have a spoonful of Mitchell's deliciousness I just don't care what is going on around me. Also, it's like two doors down from a liquor store so hey two birds with one stone. This is my favorite place in cleveland period.
Went here today to get some bulk lobster for a restaurant.  They were great and the price i got the lobster meat at was far below the larger distribution companies like cysco and haserot.

This was a great place to stay for the night. Great service, and very good value. Rooms were clean and had free WIFI. No fridge or microwave was kind of a bummer but stay was great. Would definitely recommend.

This Panera is pretty good. The food is always consistent and the employees are efficient. They are usually walking around to help clear off tables too. My only complaint is that I wish this location was bigger. It is always very busy, and often times, there are no tables available. Otherwise, this Panera is nice, and consistent with your typical Panera experience.

I ordered two whole sandwiches here, spent around $20 and then took them to go. The Avacado was brown. Bread was soggy. Now, I feel my innards turning on themselves. I am not in a position to break wind but if I was alone I'd probably be leave a nice brown streak in my pants. Never again!
Some of the nicest veterinary staff ever... even when they are busy, you feel like you are the only one there.  Office is super clean too!

I have to add to this. Today started off as a disappointing outing to B&N. We ordered our lattes and they were burnt. My husband went back up and politely explained they were burnt. The barista asks "so did you want me to remake them?" I'm thinking oh no they are so deliciously burnt we just thought we would come up and share. My husband responds yes please. 

So she remakes them. Lo and behold, burnt yet again. So he returns and says I'm sorry but these are also burnt. The barista says well I remade them. Ok and? If they are burnt I do not care how many times you remake them. Burnt is burnt. So my husband requests a refund. 

We wait for our little one to finish her pretzel and her milk. She is very happy and satisfied. The we go upstairs , she picks out a stuffed puppy and we leave. We are putting her in her car seat when we both realize she no longer has her Nintendo 3d DS. We race back just knowing it's gone for good. My California mentality kicks in, just knowing someone pocketed it and took it home. I'm trying not to panic. I got to the register and ask if anyone has turned it in. She guides me to the customer service kiosk lost and found. I ask if someone turned it in. The girl says yes, the woman just brought it a few minutes ago saying some little person was going to be extremely upset that it was gone. 

I almost cried. I wish I could thank this woman in person. Honest, compassionate, and caring. She's right. This little one is a sensitive little soul. And the meltdown that would have ensued, along with the genuine heartbreak were all averted, thanks to an honest person. 

In California had something like this happened we would barely have turned away from where it was left and someone would have snatched it and ran. And I know a good many people personally who would not have done The right thing. 

It's reaffirmed my faith in humanity and honesty. I cannot thank this person enough and wish I had been able to in person. And thank you to the staff in B&N for also being honest. Amazing!

I use to go to FirstWatch once a week....and enjoyed it.
The last time I went... I personally saw a girl working there who handled cash from a customer....picked up dirty dishes from a table...then went to the back and put bread in a toaster by hand...she never washed her hands or anything...and she did not use gloves of any kind...it was disgusting...I called them when I got home and of course the poor excuse of a manager never called me back.  This is a health violation...if this is what they do when the customer can see ...just think what goes on out of view of the customer.  I was sitting at a table back by the half wall that lets you look into the kitchen.  Disgusting....I use to work at a resturant...and I know many of them follow all the health guidelines...it is not that difficult...most are just common sense. If you eat there enjoy the germs...

Came here last week for lunch....waited 45 minutes for food. Food was below expectation. Made the mistake of trying again today... not as slow sat at bar not busy, bad sign, tender was more interested in his cell phone texting than waiting on me.   Not going back

Quality 4/5
Service 5/5
ambiance 5/5
Value 4.5/5

I've come here twice and will be coming again if I get sent out from California again. 
The quality here is pretty good. The blackened walleye is cooked well. The texture isn't too dry or too raw - just right. The flavour is rich on the side of salty. If salty ain't your thang just brush off some of the blackened part and you're good. 
The second time I've been here I had the porterhouse veal. It was delicious w the red wine sauce. My only complaint was there wasn't more, but I probably couldn't have finished it if there was anyways. 
The garlic butter noodles were amazing. It's not overly garlic or overly buttery until you get to the last few bites. Think of it like ice cream, the last few bites are blanketed in sauce. 
The house salad was a typical salad mix but their sweet and sour dressing was good. It wasn't rich or creamy like thousand island, but rather consistency of vinaigrette. It was light and sweet flavour like watered down honey mustard so was a great way to whet my appetite for the actual meal. 
Oh. The bread. It comes w a light whipped butter. 
I love ice cream. Their ice cream pie dessert is great as well. The picture is of the chocolate, but I had both chocolate and coconut. I'd say the coconut is better (less of a fan of chocolate and cool whip and more of a coconut crumble). I don't know how exactly to describe it other than delicious. Think light ice cream pie w a crumbling crust. 

The waitresses (Maureen) and owner (Beverly) were the epitome of midwestern hospitality. I came from out of state and stood out like a sore thumb. They were welcoming and you can have a decent genuine conversation. My second time back they remembered me and everything (a week and a half in between). Extremely friendly staff. 

The place feels like home almost. Actually more like grandmas house for a thanksgiving dinner. It's warm and inviting with some homey touches around (old photos and chimney for one). 

Meals were not the cheapest but you pay for the quality. Fresh catch fish + a glass of wine + dessert will run you around $35. Not too bad in the grand scheme of it all and you'll leave full. I left feeling like I ate 25 McNuggets after everything.

We stumbled into this place looking for some cheeseburger joint the hotel recommended and I am sooo glad!  Our meal and service was fantastic! We sat at the hibachi grill - I had chicken and shrimp and it was very good.  The soup and salad was perfect.  Everything tasted fresh.  Very pleasant atmosphere and the prices were decent.  Didn't try to sushi but definitely will if we ever make it back.

This is my favorite Barnes & Noble location in NE Ohio. It is located right in the middle of Crocker Park, making it easy to get to. This is a spacious, two story location. There is a huge selection of books, magazines, and other bookstore items. They serve Starbucks coffee here as well as cheesecake from The Cheesecake Factory. There are also other bakery items from what I believe is their own company bakery (although I may be wrong about that). Overall, if you're looking for a good bookstore especially on the West Side, Barnes & Noble may be for you, even though it's a chain bookstore.

Chicken hibachi was good; soup was terrible.  Salad dressing was also not good.  We both decided to leave the soup and salad untouched.  
Server was mediocre, he never brought me my rice; I had to flag down another staff member.  The server also neglected to bring us a drink menu until the END of our dinner.  The check took forever.  However,  the hibachi man was great!

We visited Asuka with a $25 Restaurant.com gift certificate planning to spend about $75-$100 overall.  We were met at the door with a notice saying Asuka no longer honored them.  The hostess didn't greet us so we asked about the certificate.  She scowled at us and said, "Not again!  You are the fourth person to try to use these!"  She told us to take it and use it somewhere else.  When we replied that we could not, she rolled her eyes and sighed heavily, saying she would give us $10 off our meal but wouldn't honor our $25 certificate.  We would have eaten there anyway, but she muttered under her breath and walked away from us. The hostess was so rude, abrupt and argumentative that we decided to leave.  

While I understand that sometimes complications arise when a restaurant can no longer honor a gift certificate or discount, one would expect an apology or at least an explanation rather then rudeness and abuse.

EDITED TO ADD:  The purchase date on this gift certificate was November 28, nearly one month *after* Asuka stopped honoring them.

My husband and I first time to Biryani Hut Express. Food was amazing and our waiter very polite/helpful. We highly recommend all to come eat or take-out at Biryani Hut Express. The murgh masala and fry tilapia was delicious!!!!!

I was hoping to enjoy the fantastic rum bar that Agave had on their website menu. So we got there, got seated and were handed cocktail menus with extensive lists of rums and tequilas. I took about ten minutes mulling over the list. Upon deciding what kind of rum mojito I wanted to try, our waitress told us that because they are relocating the only rum that they currently had was Bacardi and Captain Morgan. I have those at home, thank you. Maybe you should have informed me when you handed me the menu that you didn't have 90% of it in stock. So we gladly left and went to Momocho instead. Much better choice. You should do the same. Ohio City isn't that far.

P.S. - I only gave Agave one star because Yelp made me. I wish I could have given it zero.

My daughter and I were looking for a quick and healthy lunch yesterday and decided on First Watch.  We have never been disappointed in this restaurant.  Good menu choices, fast and courteous service, great coffee always make this one of our first breakfast or lunch choices.  My only complaint is that the chairs at the tables are quite uncomfortable for me personally - we always try to get a booth!

Fantastic.  I had gotten my hair cut here for years and only stopped because I moved out of town.  The salon is beautiful and any of the spa experiences are calming, relaxing, and conducted by utmost professionals.  The hair stylists are talented, kind, professional, and a pleasure to chat with.  I have never had a bad haircut here and have received many compliments.  I will really miss this salon.  You all need to check it out!

My second review from them. I was first to review them initially when they opened, now after 3 months running i think they are doing a great job. I almost eat here once a week. My Fav:
Gobi Manchurian
keema biryani 
gulab jamun
This isn't just a place to get sea food, it's also an outstanding restaurant. I just got the clam strip platter and made all coworkers jealous. Great brothers, great restaurant! 5/5!

Service is very inconsistent. Just recently sat down for a late dinner after a long day and sat down at a table outside. Sat for 10 minutes before going inside to ask the bartender if a server could come take our order. After another 10 minutes of nobody coming to greet the table or even acknowledge our existence we walked out. Not a single employee acknowledged us despite multiple stops at the table literally 5 feet from us. I would seriously recommend going anywhere but here, if you want anything close to customer service.

Worst owner ever. Both me and my wife had a side dish with marinara sause, the sause had a bad smell ( as if it was burnt when preparing), we told the waiteress ( she was really nice). She smelled it, agreed with us and said she will bring us new ones. After a minute she comes back and appologies to us saying the owner yelled at her and said that he made the sause today and it was fine. He never came to the table to talk to us or at least try to explain to us why it smelled so so bad. We did not even finish our food, just paid the bill and left never to return to that place again.
I have just checked in here. I did not know that they have a Panera Bread in Westlake.

I am so grateful I found this place. The staff are all wonderful and very caring. They work to make your pet comfortable. Exams are thorough and done in your presence, instead of taking your pet to the back like so many clinics do today. With 6 dogs, we've mostly seen Dr. Rex who I just love. I have one dog just recently diagnosed with cancer and Dr. Rex has consulted with oncologists to gather information to help me make decisions about his treatment.

Try the LEMON CHICKEN! The best egg rolls around, too. Super friendly service. Since I've eaten there, I won't even try egg rolls elsewhere. Old school friendly and dine in food served on covered plates. While not a "five star" dining experience, the five stars in my review are well deserved for high quality food matched by top notch service.

Today there are two ways to buy goods -- online or at a store. While I buy most things online, I still buy clothing at a store. The reason is that I like to try things on before I buy and the hassle of doing that online isn't worth it. Stores are struggling with declining sales. You would think they would understand why people still come in. All the fitting rooms at Dick's are locked, the buttons you're supposed to press don't work, and the only staff is running the cash registers. I had $100 merchandise in my arms -- but in the end I just walked out without buying anything. Dick's failed to earn my business -- it's not that the online retailers took it from them.

Went in for an oil change there for the first time.  Had a coupon and presented it. Got a brief and confusing explanation of the products. Ended up with conventional oil in my vehicle, a 2013 Honda Accord which uses synthetic oil which I knew and is clearly labeled on the oil cap. My husband noticed the mistake and called about it. I returned and was treated in a very rude manner by the person on duty ( a different person than who did the service 2 days earlier).  He acted as if I was some dumb broad and it was my fault there was a mistake. I left due to his rude and unprofessional behavior and will NEVER GO BACK AGAIN.

I like the salad and garlic knots. The chicken parm and veal parm were good. The atmosphere is just okay. The prices are a little high for the food. We come here on and off but there are better Italian restaurants out there.

I needed to get the boyfriends new Goodwill find suit jacket cleaned ASAP for the best friends wedding in less than 2 weeks.  After looking on this site, I found this cleaners. I called and was told, on  a Saturday mind, that if I brought it in that day, I could have it back by 5 p.m. on that Monday.  Wow.  It only cost $7.75 for the jacket to be cleaned (we paid $6 for a $500 Italian silk suit jacket.  The tag was still on it.) and $4.50 for the silk tie we got for a $1.00.  Not too bad.  The counter clerk was very nice, if a little deaf, as I had to repeat some info 3 times or so.  The moms volunteered to pick it up for me as she was out that way with the grams to take grams to cards.  We almost got a bonus order!  A woman's suit was accidentally picked up with my order and the clerk was insisting it was our order.  The other clerk had to straighten the first one out.  So, no 5 stars due to that, but other wise it is worth the trip for me from Fairview Park to Westlake for the rare need I have for dry cleaning.


BTW:  It is posted in the store quite clearly, ANY coupons MUST be given BEFORE you start to leave your stuff.  If you forget, too bad.

If anyone is ever looking for a real estate agent I have to recommend, NO I INSIST on Rosemary Farnsworth!!!

She is extremely sweet, efficient, knowledgeable, supportive, above average in all areas! She is on your team and will sell your home and find you a new one!  

She found us our dream home and sold our Cleveland house in ONE WEEK!!!

Her team will take care of every need from professional photos to expert contracts! She cries with you... she laughs with you!  Don't let her sweetness fool you though, she can be firm and light a fire under butts when necessary!  If she doesn't know the answer her fabulous professional team, complete with a real estate attorney, will get the answer!  This team is on FIRE! 

When one agent is out of the office a team of other agents step in (thanks Flavia) and get you top notch service with no delays! I never waited longer than 10 minutes for a response to an email or text!

I can't thank the EZ Sales Team enough... but I can refer everyone I know! Trust me when I tell you Rosemary and her team are THEE BEST!!!

I was really surprised by this place. Before you think to yourself "how could a Red Roof Inn get five stars?", know that I'm rating this off expectations for a budget hotel. This place was really clean and parts of the room had been renovated. The staff were friendly in person, and also refunded a night I couldn't stay due to travel issues. Free wifi, quiet, safe location, comfy bed. The only downside is that there's a bit of an old-hotel smell when you walk in. Not overwhelming, just a bit.

Decent food..  decent service.   Surprise at the end!  You should know that this place doesn't accept American Express!  Are they the last restaurant in North America that doesn't accept American Express??!!  A sign at the door might have been appreciated.

This place is always sooo busy, good for them printing money and all... 

No wonder, they have got it worked out, fast, friendly and efficient. Place is modern inside and the menu has a vast selection. I'm pretty simple, traditional breakfast, coffee and OJ. Coffee is great, eggs cooked right. Not big on paying at the front door but it adds to the speed at the table. I am more of a mom and pop breakfast connoisseur but you have to give the devil his due...

Best ice cream in Cleveland hands down!  Great homemade ice cream!
Tons of variety and a unique flavor for every palette.  Personal favorites are the Banana Cream Pie, Butter Pecan, and Black Raspberry Chip.
The red roof was very reasonable and the staff was friendly Laura and Susie went out of the way to make our stay pleasant. Thank you
A bit bland, long waits. Decent healthy options and price. Overall, I've just had way better breakfast elsewhere.

My experience with Pat's Cleaners has been a good one.  When we moved to Westlake from out of town, I searched for a nearby dry cleaner who was reasonably priced, reliable and would do a great job cleaning our clothes.  We used them for the last 4 months and they met all these criteria plus the clerks are friendly and remembered my name after a few visits, which meant they would have my dry cleaning order at the front by the time I got into the store (if they weren't busy helping someone else).  I never had any issues with our weekly dry cleaning or laundry items delivered and picked up.  I began using another dry cleaner when we moved out of the area.

Lunchtime and there's 8 people here! Maybe because per usual, the y have a choice of 5 bagels and 4 loaves of bread! Unengaged employees and turkey sandwiches with 3 Oz of meat! Why do we keep coming back here!!!

I was going in the past to the Westlake location of Super Tan when I knew a really awesome girl there that wouldn't try and up sell me everything under the sun there. Since she left I continued to go back and forth between the Westlake location and the Lakewood location. 

Now, Ive been frequenting tanning salons for years and I'm not an idiot when it comes to the fact that when you're being sold a lie, you're being sold a lie. Multiple sales staff have tried to sell me "bargain" packs of sample lotions, except that these are lotions that haven't been manufactured in YEARS so without a doubt they'd be expired. I called the young lady on it who was trying to sell it to me by polity saying "um..I think those lotions are old, they don't make those anymore do they?".


 When the salon switched over to a different brand of product, I was again, trying to be sold more lotion that I didn't need. I was getting irritated at this point because the manager at the Lakewood location wasn't listening to me when I told him multiple times on multiple visits that I didn't like a certain type of lotion, he kept trying to sell it to me anyway because it was "made just for guys". I don't care! I'm happy with the lotion that I have! For the record I almost never buy lotion at salons because they're marked up so much. I usually find the same product online for much cheaper. 

After a few more visits and leaving feeling like I was being pushed around to buy a new lotion or upgrade my beds, I finally called it quits once and for all with Super Tan. 

I still think that they have top notch beds don't get me wrong; they salons were always clean, the prices weren't too bad and the multiple locations were convenient. However, the fact that every time I'd visit and was almost always trying to be a sold something new became a huge turn off and ultimately lead to me leaving.

Brunch this morning with my hubby. The restaurant is gorgeous! The food excellent. The made to order omelets and crepes were hot, fresh and delicious. We didn't have any little ones with us but enjoyed watching The Balloon Man create magical balloon sculptures for the kids.

This was our first visit here. We had great service tonight and loved the food. My husband who is usually so critical of restaurants, loved it too! They have live piano music Friday's and Saturday nights.  The portions are big but they'll box what's left up for you. On top of that, they'll wrap them in plastic so no spills! Will recommend and definitely go again!!!!!!'A++++

If I could give this place 6 stars, I would!!! The ice cream is phenomenal and the staff is even better. My personal favorites are banana cream pie and the seasonal lavender honey. That being said, I have never come across a flavor that I don't like. Even the vegan flavors are out of this world! Another big plus is their lasting effort of gathering local and sustainable ingredients. It's a little pricey but it is well worth it for the quality of the ice cream! If you ever find yourself in Cleveland looking for a sweet treat, I would recommend Mitchell's ice cream all the way.
Great little place.  I stopped in for a beer and a quick snack.  The service was good.  A good selection of beers and some different food options - like the Cajun Pretzels.  Very good.

I think I'll need to have a little more experience with this place to confidently bump my rating, though I give the food an initial 4 stars...I think.

We came here for a birthday party, so my first experience was a little different from the norm, which is why I'm iffy on a confident high rating. When we arrived, we were incredibly hungry and wanted to grab a couple of beers and put a food order in as quickly as possible. When we snagged our server and got a couple of menus, we expected her to come back ready to take our orders. This was not so. We went to the bar and attempted to place them, where we were turned away because our server was heading our direction again. She completely overlooked us and we went on, hungry and parched, regretting not placing our order with force at the bar. 

Anyways, when the party quickly became bigger than projected, we were moved into the "back" where there was another bar and more seating for us. When we sat down, it seemed as though there were 2 different servers checking on us and buzzing around the area in confusion. I'm guessing it was because the girl that was serving the party on the other side wasn't going to continue to serve us on this side. So, we patiently waited for someone to take our orders and even mentioned to a couple of people a couple of times that we wanted to place an order with them. We got a few "one sec"s, which turned out to be a good 15 minutes. Eventually when the official bartender (I think he could be called the official one...) came, we placed an order at the bar. I do believe that this place is more efficient when it's a normal everyday crowd and not a larger than expected birthday party, or at least I want to believe it. 

I'd like to say all of the chaos was worth the delicious fish sandwich I had, but not quite. It was, in fact, one of the more impressive fish sandwiches I've had at a bar, but I was also famished and packing peanuts would have worked for me at that point. The fries were good, too. Pretty standard bar fries. But, the kicker for me was the cole slaw. I. Don't. Like. Cole. Slaw. I ate my little cup of coleslaw and loved it! But, like I said, this could have been the serious hunger convincing me that I liked it. The Blue Moon was Blue Moon: delicious.
Stopped in for Breakfast with a buddy and the kids. Very busy place so call ahead on weekends. Polite and gracious service. Decent selection of food for all types of diets.

The quality of work was decent, but I have a major issue with their service.  This company offers coupons in several mailers.  However, one time I couldn't locate a coupon from the mail, so I checked their website.  On their main page, there is a button that says "Click here for this months coupon."  I printed this out, but the woman in the store refused to take it.  She said she didn't accept printed coupons because there was no way to scan them.  I mentioned it came from her website, but she still refused it.  Fine, whatever.  The next time I received a coupon in the mail, I looked for a bar code or number code, but there was nothing on the mailers for them to scan either.  So on a second occasion when I couldn't find a mailer, I printed a coupon from their site.  Again the woman refused and said the same nonsense about not being able to scan it.  When I mentioned that there was nothing on the mailers for her to scan either, she replied "well that's what I've been told."  That was my last time using Pat's cleaners.  I use a different dry cleaner now, and I'm very happy with them.
Go there just about every Sunday morning for breakfast. Quality food and nice servers. Get there early or prepare to wait awhile.

Terrible service. Waitress brought water. Never asked if we wanted anything else to drink. We asked for a minute to look over the menu, and 5 mins later she finally came back. It was another 20 mins before our food arrived.....cold. By then we were out of water. Employees standing around not doing talking. All that being said, the food itself was good, even if it was cold.

This is a business far more concerned with profit than service.  Patients are charged up front;  the doctor can't be bothered with anything non-surgical so most care is provided by a nurse;  results, in my case at least, were sub-par for very expensive treatment.  I had gone to Dr. Pycha, who sold his business to Dr. Raj.  Day and night in terms of both care and result.  I was pretty disappointed.

In the past, I've hated dealing with the people at the tanning salon because they're the stereotypical too-tan superficial girls who are too busy on their cell phones to care about you. This place has changed that for me! They have GREAT customer service. They always remember my name, and make really good recommendations on how to get tan fast but not burn. Great prices too - much better deals than other tanning salons around the area. I'm paying $25 a month for unlimited tanning (which includes the stand-up booth!), plus your first 10 tans are in any bed you want, and a spray tan. Not pushy at all, very cool people.
I've always had a great experience at Ironwood. The food and service are excellent. We had lunch at the bar today....super, as always!!

I have been going to this establishment for over two years and I have a great experience every single time. 

The service is almost always amazing. All servers are super attentive and hospitable. And I love that they always have a kettle of coffee when they first come to your table because I am a girl that needs her coffee. 

The menu is expansive and has something that everyone would love to eat. When I feel like eating right, I get either the Healthy Turkey omelet or the Tri-Athlete omelet. Both are cooked with egg whites and filled with delicious, high quality meats, cheeses, and veggies. They are super filling without the guilt. When I feel like not counting calories, I get the chocolate chip pancakes. These pancakes are massive. We're talking almost a full 12 inches in diameter!  And you get two of them (I don't think I'm brave enough to get 3). They are so fluffy and delicious and worth every single calorie I'm sure they're loaded with. 

If you haven't tried First Watch, I suggest you try it. Though it is very busy on the weekends, it's worth the wait!

After seeing so many positive reviews on Yelp, I decided to take my two chihuahuas to the Westlake Animal Hospital for their annual exams. We were initially greeted by Brittany Ragnoni, who is probably the friendliest person I've ever met at a veterinary clinic. We then met with Dr. Katie Rex, who was supported by a pair of caring and helpful technicians. My dogs are 13 years old and 10 years old, so I've seen a lot of veterinarians over the years but I can say that my experience with Dr. Rex and her team was hands down the best experience I've ever had with a vet. We had a long, detailed discussion about the medical history and needs of my two dogs -- and Dr. Rex was understanding, informative and compassionate. I'm sure there were other patients being seen but it felt like we were the only patient -- we weren't rushed, all of my questions were answered, and I was fully confident that Dr. Rex's recommendations were made with the best interest of my pets in mind. Dr. Rex is in a class by herself.
One of the best restaurants in Cleveland ! Most authentic Hyderabadi biryani I have ever had, Would totally recommend this place !

So I haven't been here in a few years, but I met a friend for brunch. They have remodeled the inside and it looks nice - kinda rustic. We were seated quickly, and coffee and water was brought right away. The coffee is ok, nothing special. Individual pots are brought to each table, and while that's a good idea, our coffee pot had a giant greasy handprint on it so I was leery of how often they are cleaned.
We ordered and food was quickly delivered. I got the BLT eggs Benedict and my friend had the veggie omelette. Both were good and filling, and included greens on the side. A nice breakfast all in all, minus the dirty coffee pot. Go early on weekends to avoid a long wait.

I absolutely LOVE Ibi David Salon!! Ibi David is an Aveda salon that offers hair, nail, waxing and spa services, and I've been taking advantage of all of those services for the last 3 years. The staff is kind, caring and very professional. I love that I'm usually greetd by name when I arrive for an appointment. Their commitment to keeping up with trends and new techniques really shows in the quality of the services provided, too. No matter what service I'm having done I feel very well taken care of and pampered. I also love that they don't aggressively push products at customers just for the sake of making a sale. I've had a bad experience with a large Aveda salon in Westlake that is ruthless when it comes to selling product. My stylist's and esthetician's product recommendations have always been helpful and personal to my needs.

There are so few places that you can escape to for a few hours to just relax and do something nice for yourself. I would recommend Ibi David to anyone looking for a little getaway on the west side. You'll walk out feeling relaxed and fabulous!!

This store is clean and fairly well stocked. If they don't have something, they can order it online for free shipping and ship to to the store or your house. The only issue is that the restrooms are never clean and returns take forever. The only people that truly can do a return easily are managers. If you need to do a complicated return, I would ask for a manager. There is a smaller garage next to the large one at Crocker that has very close parking to the side entrance. 

Update: 

Recently purchased some socks, and when I returned home the security tag was on them. It was a major inconvenience as I wanted to wear the socks that night but was unable to. I was checked out by a girl named Avery, who paid no attention to detail when scanning my socks. Disappointing

This location didn't even pop up on Yelp until recently. It is pretty big inside compared to other locations. Very well placed for easy in and out with ample parking. 

We ordered five separate meals with soups and sides to go. Food was as good as any other Panera and came out perfectly as ordered with a minimal wait. Pastries were fresh and delicious. We had a fresh baked cookie while we waited and definitely did not regret that choice. 

Overall, a very nice addition to the Westlake food options!

Was in Westlake looking for an apartment as I am relocating from South Florida to start a job at St. John medical center. This hotel is by far the best value in the area, and is extremely clean and tidy. Service is excellent and staff are always friendly. I am quite picky when it comes to hotels, and I highly recommend this location.

BEWARE AND BE WARED. not a good company I got my mom a coat and she took it to their smith road location the tag on the coat said dry clean only but my mom wasn't sure about the coat because it had leather trim around it she asked them before she left it there with them if they could clean it and they said yes when she went back to pick up the coat it was ruined my mom talked to the owner Lauren and she said she would not do nothing for my mom so she is out $17.00 to clean the coat and the owner did not even care about my mom she is 78 years old on a fixed income I am telling everyone I know about my mom's horrible experience,  Horrible customer service...

This bar/restaurant is so close to home. We go here every couple of months and the food is pretty good. The fish fry is tasty! 

It gets pretty busy on Fridays during Lent. So be sure to grab a seat early!
3 words: geauga maple walnut !!!

Really nice restaurant.  Some have said the decor needs updating but it it kind of retro.  Friendly staff and service.  They still bring the dishes out in the metal dishes with the lids.  Food was wonderful and reasonable.  Location a little hard to find, not in a plaza.

Caters to older crowd but very complete menu from burgers to steaks, prime rib, pasta and seafood.  Every course was excellent.  Prime rib perfectly cooked.  This may become my new favorite place.  Reservations are suggested on the weekend.  It has a Cheers atmosphere where everyone seems to know everyone.  Norm!!!!
Best Ice Cream In Cleveland bar none.  Multiple locations around Cleveland and worth the trip from anywhere.

This is a great breakfast/brunch/lunch spot and better than some of the other FW locations I've visited. 

The service is friendly and fast and the food is always delicious. My fave is the pesto chicken quinoa bowl. Very flavorful and filling, yet still fairly healthy.

Nothing like starting the day off right. Especially on a Monday. Decided to stop in for a quickie. Just eggs toast and sausage. Everything was cooked to perfection. The potatoes were on point. And note that they are cooked in a butter substitute, had to ask. But what made my experience the best was my server Zakiya. She was the sweetest woman. She has a great personality and smile and played in to my antics. She's worth a 100% tip. I couldn't have started my weekend off better. I should do this more often.

I've tried many Indian restaurants and this one didn't particularly blow me away. We got the chicken tikka masala and murgh masala. They brought one of the orders out about 5 minutes before the other, which was a bit odd considering we were the only customers there. The chicken was also burnt on the outside layer. The staff seemed friendly and the restaurant was clean, but my overall experience can be summed up as average.

I've been here several times over the past 7 years and haven't been let down. 
The atmosphere inside is very classy and relatively quiet. The service is exceptional. There aren't many places anymore where the staff attempts to get to know you and greets you by name. They are so friendly here! 

The food is outstanding. I love the Lake Erie Perch, although I haven't been disappointed by a dish here ever. 

It's a slightly older crowd here. I was taken by my parents, and it remains a favorite go-to place of theirs since their first time. I will keep coming back!
Excellent food, service had a little bit of a snotty attitude. Would def try again tho
Having our work christmas party here.  So far it's decent, I seen better but can't really complain.  Looks nice and the food taste great.
It's great for what it is - an easy and inexpensive breakfast spot. I normally come once a week and I've never had a bad meal nor bad service here. Will definitely continue to frequent FW!

A local joint in Cleveland Paninis is pretty rockin. They are famous for their sandwiches that are served with a healthy service of deli meat, topped with a delicious vinegar slaw and their in house French fries, all on the sandwich! The staff and service is on top of it and know what you need even before you do. The flavors are amazing and the size of the meal is sure to satisfy, but if your really hungry double meat is always an option here. Your gonna love it.

I think the last time I went to Asian Wok I was about 6.  Although the ambiance is a little strange, I was thoroughly satisfied with the food.  I judge pretty much all Chinese places on the crab rangoon, and it was pretty decent here.  They had specials too, some sounded great.
The chicken fried is really good. I ordered extra spicy and it is exactly extra spicy. Loved it.!!!

Super quaint restaurant in a nice shopping area. To start, we had the rainbow toast which was awesome. I've never had anything like that before. My boyfriend had the salmon eggs Benedict. He liked it. I had The Works omelette with fruit. The only thing I was disappointed in is that the omelette was room temperature and the meats were just thrown in it after the eggs were cooked. It made me not want to finish it. It wasn't even a busy morning which I would understand (we went on a Tuesday morning at 0900). I would imagine the omelette would've tasted great if it was still warm.

Sour and tart.  Not the food, the service.  Lunchtime chickie is downright dismal.  Two visits.  Two bad moods.  Never came back to check on the table.  Not once.  She seems pre-occupied with daily bar tasks.

The other problem is the flying insects; gnats and flies buzzing about.  I don't appreciate waving my hands around shooing bugs during a meal.

Food is pretty darn good, though.  Tortilla soup was very cheesy and had plenty of chicken.  A nice variety of salads are offered.  Quality tasting fish and burgers.

Take the food recipes and place them in another building with better help.

So, I had to get away for a few days, and decided that Cleveland was a quick easy location.  I scoured hotels.com and found that this place was not only reasonably priced, but in a great location in regards to food, shopping, the expressway and downtown.  I booked my stay, and off I went.

When I arrived, I was happy to get here.  The hotel isn't anything fancy. It's definitely clean and safe, but if you want a 5 star Hilton, keep driving.  I arrived at 12:30, and even though check in time is 2PM, the staff was nice enough to let me check in early!  I liked this because I've been to other hotels and they were much more rigid about check in time.  Plus, I was a bit tired from driving and really wanted to rest and relax.

I also had requested a second floor room for security purposes, since I was traveling alone.  They accommodated this as well, which made me even happier.  I had the two queen beds reserved, and when I walked into the room, I was happy to see that it was in great shape!  They had a flatscreen TV with 42 channels, free WIFI with an awesome full signal, and a great little setup going on here with a desk area as well.

But, here's where I dock a star. I lumped it all together because I was really happy with the staff AND my stay here overall.  First, the room I booked was wonderful, but came without a coffee maker. I didn't realize this, and I guess for a few extra bucks a night I could have reserved a different room.  No, I can live with walking across the parking lot to get some coffee when needed, but coffee is kind of a big deal to me in the morning.  The girl at the desk said that normally they have a few extra machines to "check out" for people who want it, but they didn't have any available.  Boo.

Secondly, the socket in the bathroom counter area must have reset itself because after I had taken a shower that night, I was unable to turn on my hairdryer.  I tried to reset it myself, but was unable to do so.  The next morning when I was on my way out, the nice maintenance man took care of it for me, so it did resolve itself.  Thirdly, the toilet did have to be manually reset because it was running after I had used it. It was only this one time my first night, and no I didn't complain about it because I fixed it myself!

On the bonus side, the desk is always staffed 24/7. I had great experiences here, and every morning they had out a baggie breakfast to people!  You get a bottle of water, a fresh apple, and your choice of muffins.  I went with the Chocolate muffin bag, so I really liked that!  Also, I received daily room service, so my beds were made, towels were restocked and everything was put back in order.

I was very happy with my stay here.  I felt safe and secure, and will gladly return to Red Roof on my future visits to Cleveland. Thank you Red Roof, you really made an awesome impression!

Coming from an Indian girl who loves trying out Indian restaurants as much as cooking Indian food at home, this is the most authentic restaurant you will find in Cleveland. I think this is probably one of the best Indian restaurants I have tried in the states!!

I've come to their lunch quite a few times with my brother. It's typically very quiet and slow so the service is great for us. Food is really good, and portions are enormous! As others have mentioned the bread is absolutely killer. The location and decor are lacking in ambiance, but it's still a nice place. And the patio is nice too. If you like Italian it'd be dumb to pass this place up!

I've been to Lobster Bros many times over the years, and have been pleased with the selection and quality of fresh seafood, for the most part.  There has been a lot of negative news lately about how many American seafood distributors and/or restaurants are serving lower quality, different fish than what is indicated on the menu, which is disturbing, and has turned off a lot of seafood lovers.  I don't believe that Lobster Bros engages in this kind of dishonesty.  I've been very happy with what I purchase there, and sure that I am indeed getting what they tell me I am.  On a sidenote, if you like chilled 'cocktail shrimp', you must try a Cleveland product called "Al's Gourmet Shrimp Sauce" (Seven Seas Seafood Co.).  It is truly one of the best shrimp sauces i've ever had, and can be found at some supermarkets in our area.

Second time here and the kitchen is still slow. Took an hour to get our food. First time here was an absolute catastrophe I won't even go into. This location does not hold up to the Panonis standard we've come to expect.

Food was incredible.  Sounds weird,  but this place has the best toast. We actually tried to find the bakery online to buy some. The place was clean and well run.  Smooth service.  Nice space.  We had breakfast and it was simply some of the best breakfast food we have had.

Stopped for a night passing through and this was one of the lowest priced available. The rate drops about 35$ during the week. The lobby is small with carafe coffee. "Grab and go" breakfast is what is offered.  The room mostly clean with the exception of sketchy bed spread and bath shower area. Minimal towels and the bathroom is TINY TINY. The area offers shopping, parks, restaurant and free entrance to fitness USA down the road. For a rate around 50ish, would be a deal. 80 and 90$ is a bit high for what this place offers. We liked the area and drive to a couple of parks and Wholefoods. We would stay short term again. Oh yeah...no elevators. Drag.
Giovanni Carelli sells the best fitting and looking suits that you can get in Cleveland. I would not recommend buying a suit elsewhere and having it tailored there as one negative review mentioned.

This is the only place where I will get Chicken Chow Mein from.  I have been getting it here for years. 

The only problem is the food quality is not always consistent. Sometimes I find it to be overly salty.

A convenient place for Chinese food.  Have visited regularly and am usually satisfied. My favorite place for MuShu pork, never disappoints.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars was the crab Rangoon, another favorite dish.  Last night was served fried wontons, masquerading as Rangoon.  There was but a hint of cream cheese and no crabmeat, I questioned what I was served and was assured it was Rangoon, when I showed the lack of filling, I got a shrug and the conversation was over.  Will get pot stickers next time
Lots of workers, but no one to help you!  Food-only thing that was hot was my coffee.  Disappointed. Coffee was good!

I've eaten at Dadonna's a few times and gotten carry-out a few more.  We used to like it, but now I'm done with this place.  Tonight we paid for soggy calamari that was slightly red as it appeared a little sauce had been spilled on it - not sure if that was intentional.  Anyway, it was gross.  The salads were limp and obviously thrown carelessly into the containers - just a bunch of barely chopped iceberg lettuce, a slice of cucumber, some grated carrot and a generous handful of cheap mozzarella cheese.  The blue cheese dressing had a taste of blue cheese in it, but nothing vaguely resembling actual pieces of blue cheese - it looked and tasted like it came from a large can.  The meat sauce for the spaghetti had no meat in it.  The marinara sauce for the other order of spaghetti was bland - were any spices used in it?  The meatballs were overcooked, mushy and vile-tasting.  The chicken marsala was okay - that's the best I can say about it, not bad, nothing special, just okay.  With half a dozen other decent Italian restaurants in and around Westlake, there's no reason to waste your time and money on something like this.  Yuck!

Came in tonight our experience wasn't the best. 
Husband ordered a patty melt with fries and I had a buffalo chicken sandwich with fries . My chicken wasn't very hot and both of our fries were so over cooked and VERY HARD and kind of cold. I gave the server one of my long fries and said feel this I could beat a drum with it . He went away showed a manager and for that low grade food I got a whole $10 off for my NEXT VISIT from that Generous manager .  The best part of our meal was the service.

Do not go here! They treat customers horribly! 
Wanted to take my Grandmother to a local restaurant that my Grandfather used to like to take her to and bought a coupon from Restaurant.com to use.  The place smells foul when you walk in and the food was nothing exciting.. When I gave them the gift card they were mean and even angry with me saying they don't except these. I was very embarrassed since my grandmother was there with me and they made a bit of a scene in the middle of the restaurant.. I will never go here again and hope this story will make you choose to not visit this place either!

Best place for new tires & conveniently right down the street. Drop it in the morning & pick it up by 1800. Easy peasy. Quick & painless. Just what u want for new tires. 

New Goodyear fortera for my grand Cherokee $860 out the door, incl. free flat repairs, lifetime wheel balance & rotations. Bing bang boom saved $140 off the dealer quote. Love it. 

These type places have the reputation for running up the services i.e. new brakes etc. but none of that at Detroit Dover Conrad's. Even checked the alignment & not necessary. And mine is a high mileage 4x4. Thanks Conrad's excellent job as usual, the best price & u can't beat the $34 per tire install incl. tire protection.

The is the only place i make a stop every time i visit Cleveland Ohio, usually I'm here with groups all the time the way we can try different items. The one best dish makes me to stop is keema Biriyani and dosas which are exactly same as hotel dosas in india. My recent visit i had tried veg and non-veg thalis feels stunning experience all my taste buds born. Feeling sad can't stay here need drive back to home. The guy who served us this time is very polite and more respectful, I appreciate the service and food to chiefs. Great maintenance 

Thank you all 
See you on my next visit to ohio

Very Very delicious! Atomsphere is a mix of modern design with the traditional Japanese decor.  There are 2 sides to the restaurant: one with the sushi bar and traditional dining room, the other with hibachi dining tables.  The atmosphere is great with plenty of good sushi and food to pick from.  I enjoyed every roll I ate.  The sushi is very good for Ohio and much better than Sushi Rock!  The rolls are a bit more creative and tasty: you don't need Soy sauce for them TRY BEFORE YOU SATURATE IN SOY SAUCE.  Make sure to check out the volcano, tiger, victoria secret, and ima gastu (not sure of spelling on the last one).  They are a bit more pricer than other sushi places such as Sushi Rock, but the sushi is well worth it.  They also offer you more than other places: 8 big pieces from one of their rolls vs. 6 medium/small pieces from other places.  You can expect to be full with 2.5-3 rolls per a person.  On Mondays they offer 30% on sushi rolls!  On Mondays expect to spend roughly 25-30 per person depending on the gourmet rolls (the more gourmet and unique the higher)  and roughly 10-20 per person with the typical sushi rolls.  Other days be prepared to spend roughly 40-50 on the gourmet rolls and 25-35 on the regular sushi rolls

Went here on a Sunday and it was packed! Took us 35-40 mins to get a table.(Which was ok and gave us time to shop) They'll ask you for your phone number so they can text you when a seat is ready.  I was with my wife and 2 yr old daughter and I would say it took a good 20 mins to get our food.  We both had the pick two which was a great value as we both chose the salad and sandwich $7.49 each.   We both had the beefeater sandwich and the dijon pecan chicken salad.  We also split a trifecta which is similar to a grand slam at Denny's but we chose the Belgium waffle and bacon, two over easy eggs.  The Decor is similar to Panera Bread. The quality and portions of food are better then Panera pick 2 combo's.  The trifecta I would pass on next time as the belgium waffle let me down a bit and the bacon and egg's were so-so.  I will definitely try the pancakes next time around. as I saw them at another table and looked tasty!  Going back for sure for another pick 2 and some pancakes!

This is a lovely Japanese restaurant with a beautiful interior. I think Japanese salad dressings are the best anywhere, and the salad here is no exception. The shrimp tempura was good, but, I must say, greasy - I couldn't quite finish it. The udon was good. A nice place.

I can live with bad service and bored bartenders if the beer is cheap. I can live with expensive beer if the service is good and the bartenders are attractive. If you want to feel like you are being ripped off with every sip and love indifferent service this place is perfect for you.

Not a good place for vegetarians.  There's like 1 vegetarian thing on the menu. But the food is good and the French fries are delicious. Beware of one of the tvs though. There's a channel with gross stuff on it and it's disturbing while your eating

Heard a couple of good things about Lobster Brothers.. They send coupons through the mail all the time. Always wanted to try them out, finally decided to give it ago. Ordered the crab cake sandwich.. Not bad but not good.. If I paid full price (7) dollars, I would have felt ripped off.. Also ordered the seafood platter. Comes with scallops clam strips shrimp French fries and a roll  (12) dollars. Save your money.. It's just frozen seafood placed in a fryer.. Your local grocery store has better frozen seafood. Won't be going back.. Then again what can one expect from a seafood place in a little strip mall.

The guys were very polite and eager to getbto work. They were able to come in 1 hour early!  They worked quickly and efficiently.  I am very pleased with the customer service I received.  I would recommend this company to everyone.  They really mean they will make your haul/move stress free.  Thank you C.H.M.J.

Agave is an average Mexican restaurant in Crocker Park. The atmosphere is very trendy, which I actually like. There are two areas of the restaurant, the main dining room and the bar area. The restaurant feels very spacious. Mexican artwork is all over the walls, and the artwork is pretty good. Now for the food. You're served chips and salsa just like at most Mexican restaurants. I thought the chips were too salty, but the salsa was really good. It had a refreshing taste to it. It wasn't too spicy, but just right (I'm also not a big fan of really spicy food). Someone at our table ordered the guacamole to share. I thought the guacamole was really good. There were tomatoes and feta cheese in it, which I thought worked really well. I ordered the Cuban Sliders and shared the California Burrito with someone else. The Cuban Sliders were good, but not great. They had pulled pork, cheddar cheese, cole slaw, pickles, mayo, and mustard on them. They came with fries, which were pretty good. It felt really out of place in a Mexican restaurant though. If they had been excellent, I wouldn't have cared about them being out of place. The California Burrito had kind of a funky taste to it. It wasn't terrible, but again, it wasn't great. It had steak, rice, beans, cheese, lettuce, guacamole, salsa, & sour cream. I just couldn't figure out what about it tasted weird, but it did. Overall, Agave is a place that if I was invited to go there, I would, but I would never go there on my own. There is better Mexican food to be had in Cleveland.

I never thought I'd saying getting an oil change was fun, but Take 5 Oil Change already has me excited for my next visit.  Taking time out of your day for an oil change is not necessary if you go here.  My five minute experience was a nice break. While they men checked my car, I waited with the water and fruit snacks they gave me.  The workers were so respectful and thorough.  They recommend that I have a filter changed, but did not push their services.  Once they were finished, the manager checked in with me to make sure I was satisfied. All around it was a fantastic 10/10! Thank you!

First Watch had surprisingly good breakfast/brunch food. The surprising part for me was that the food tasted great, and was filling at the same time.  I expected something less sustaining because of the healthy, fresh ingredients.  I had the Chile Chorizo omelet,  with toast and potatoes.  Everything was really delicious. Service was spot-on, and our wait time was not long at 15 minutes, considering we went on a Saturday at noon.  The only negative was the side of "greens."  I expected mustard greens, collard greens, something cooked, with some kind of spice maybe?  The side of greens is basically a small plate with lettuce on it, no spice, nothing, just sitting sad looking little lettuce sitting on a plate, for $2.49. Pass on the greens, and go for bacon or sausage instead if you want a side. Other than the greens, everyone at our table of 8 was happy with their choices. I would definitely eat at First Watch again.

i was raised in italy with gelato made traditionally in small places in the firenze (florence,tuscany) neighborhoods. this place almost reminds me that,also the staff is very polite happy (abbey)...maybe its the sugar...hahahah... love it!!!

I go to First Watch Restaurants quite often in Arizona and always get great food and service. 

This morning's food was very good, as expected. However, our server, Lori, was quite rude and unpleasant to work with. Lori should not be in a customer facing role. 

Everyone else seemed fine and quite pleasant.

Very disappointed in the service and the time it to get our food-  not totally sure if it was the kitchen being slow or the waitress - to be fair we did have a group of 10-  4 adults 6 kids
We sat outside on patio - very nice -  
Got our drinks- ordered food - got the appetizer very quick- one of the kids got their food- 
20 minutes later next food came-  
Very slow - asked for steak sauce and mayo for steak sandwich. - 20 minutes later comes back and says they don't have steak sauce - and had to ask for mayo - 5 minutes later -- mayo arrives 
Waited for bill - waited - then came and asked how bill was to be split 20 minutes later. Bills arrive- 20 minutes later returns  with credit card receipt - 
Seated 12:40pm -  left at 2:50pm 
We did order in shifts - but should never take this long a place that really wasn't busy-  
We were here yesterday and service and food were great- -   Dropped over $200 in two days and it will be a long time till we return!!
Amazing food, clean restaurant, and the manager is super nice!  He made sure I caught my plane on time! Anyway, try the Floridian French Toast or the Banana Granola Pancakes... Yum!

Disgusted! Waitress (using this dated term due to the clientele) greeted us by spilling water and ice on table, then threw the ice on the floor! Inquired on the number of scallops that accompany the dish with angel hair. The response: "there's enough!"  Really??  I walked out and will never return!

Pretty good Chinese food and they are always supper quick when we do take out.  They make all their sauces in house, the spicy mustard is our favorite.  All the people who work there are really nice too.  It's nice to have quick, good food close to our hotel.

Just what the Westside needed.  An authentic Japanese restaurant!  It seems that you need reservations for the "private" hibachi room so call ahead if you want the knife juggling show.  Great service, great food.  Definitely not the greatest Japanese restaurant I've ever been too but it's a step in the right direction.  Overall, I was really impressed with this place.
Friendly wait staff and quiet environment. Big portions too! Perfect for a date night or family dinner.

This is our favorite restaurant, hands down! My boyfriend introduced me to Daddona's five years ago, and we've frequented ever since! The wedding soup is delicious, the garlic rolls are absolutely TO DIE for, and the dinners are amazing! My boyfriend's meal of choice is the Pasta Carbonara, he's never got anything else as long as I've known him! Haha. He definitely looks forward to it. I usually get the delicious Chicken Parmagiana, and this time I finally decided to try the Chicken Jobre I've always been eyeing. FABULOUS! This will be my new go-to meal. Thanks for keeping everything fresh, delicious, and of the highest quality! We always look forward to our Daddona's dates ;)
Andrea cut my hair. Best haircut I have ever gotten. Highly recommend getting your hair cut here by Andrea

One of the best places to go for authentic Indian food! I loved the flavors at Biryani hut express and the staff is really friendly . You won't be disappointed and I would totally recommend the place to others.I am a vegetarian and my personal favourites  are paneer biryani and vegetarian ball manchuria!!!! This place is spiced just right.

I went there for lunch on recommendation of a colleague. I found the environment a little sterile or stark. Wait staff was ok, but all were young people who seemed disconnected or disinterested. I guess I was looking for a little more private, local owner feel. Food was non-descript neither great nor bad. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here again.

Great turtle sundae.  Seasonal flavors are great.  My favorite is the strawberry rhubarb crunch.  Other favs in our household are the campfire smore, and carmel sea salt.  Homemade waffle cones made daily.    Locally sourced supplies make for great product

Great place, so happy to find great Indian food in my area. We got the fried corn as an appetizer and it was amazing - salty, crunchy, spicy and sweet. I got the butter chicken and my fiancé had the goat vindaloo and both dishes were excellent as well.

There's a reason weekend brunch is packed. Coffee is wonderful and the menu fresh. We've been several times and it's consistently delicious, worth using the wait app to reserve a table on your way to save waiting time.

Top Notch!  Thank you so much for making my move stress-free and easy.  Three guys: fast, efficient, and very professional.  My friend Amber recommended College Hunks, and I will pay it forward and recommend them as well.  I appreciate the great communication from Scott, the owner and from the guys who did my move.  I've had some tough experiences with movers in the past, but College Hunks made this very smooth and hassle-free.  Strong work, guys.

Visiting this area for the 1st time.  The food here is absolutely amazing.  Started off with the Wedge Salad and had the Lasagna for my meal.  The lasagna was extremely fresh and was probably the best I have ever had.  The service was very good and the staff was very accommodating to our large group.  
Highly recommend!

I've have gone to the same hair dresser for 4 years and then one day she just quit. I didn't know what to do or where to go...I felt lost. I asked around to everyone to see where was a good place to go and I heard nothing but good things about Ibi David Salon so I decided to give it a shot. Today was my first color and cut there, it was warm, welcoming and I was greated by smiling faces. I had my color completed by Rachel and my cut by Ibi herself. I was nervous at first, hoping my hair wouldn't turn out to be something I hated or looking like a disaster. The comfort of the entire place made that fear disappear right away...i felt like I was in good hands. The service alone was above and beyond making sure I was comfortable,(above part) hand and arm massage while my hair was toned!!! It was purely amazing!. I felt pampered the moment I walked in and lasted the entire time I was there. The best part of all when it was all said and done...I fell in love with my hair again. Rachel and Ibi did wonders together and I couldn't be happier! If you are thinking about trying this salon, I said do it! You are not going to regret it, you will love that you made the choice. I know I am, I'll be a customer for life! Thank you!

Great breakfast spot. Fresh quality ingredients, healthy choice options with calories listed on all items. Great fresh artesian bread choices, jams and breakfast potatoes. Many choices fir breakfast and lunch. 
Expect to wait for a table during peak times and weekends although worth the wait. Community table available for quick breakfasts.
The food taste fantastic.. like home made.. they have many dishes both Veg and Non Veg.. missing home made food.. stop by and enjoy.

This is the best Red Roof that I have ever stayed at.  Excellent location and grounds,  my room was very clean and the staff was positively amazing!  I have only stayed at 2 other Red Roof Inns...just wish they were more consistent so you could count on them!
i only gave it four stars because I've only ate here once. the pancakes were very good. so moist that syrup is just optional.

This is a new Indian restaurant in Westlake that we ordered take out from. This is in the same place as the kabob place which closed. I would give 3.5 stars if I could and only on the food we ordered . 
The service was fast. The phone order was right. 

We ordered chicken 65 and the chicken dum biriyani. Both ordered medium spicy which was the right amount of spice and anything more would definitely not be palatable and I do eat and like spicy food. 

Chicken 65 was ok taste wise however The chicken was very chewy. Not something I will want to order again. 

The dum biriyani was worth the price, a near 5 star, the chicken was well cooked and juicy. The korma with it however wasn't tasty And if it's not improved would rather skip it. 

I would definitely give it another try and hopefully can improve on my rating.

despite its crappy name (who names a restaurant First Watch?  It sounds like a homeland security issue) First Watch has some good eats for the first half of your day.

They're only open until 2 pm, so you know that the food they are offering has been well thought out for breakfast food.  They offer lunch foods as well, but if you're going to a restaurant specializing in good breakfast foods, why pass up that opportunity?

Apparently this place is always packed, especially on the weekends.  Despite the longer wait for brunch, the wait staff is efficient and attentive.  Our waitress was actually really cool, and probably the best server i've had in a long time.

the coffee is good (they even offer free coffee while you wait for a table), the service prompt, and my omelette with avacado and salsa was huge and filling.

they don't offer any "brunch specials" like a full time restaurant, since they only do breakfast and lunch.  but i do think they said they have daily specials..none of which include the big breakfast for cheap including an alcoholic beverage.

that must be a new york thing, which i'm sadly missing.

then again, an alcoholic beverage with brunch is a different type of brunch.  brunch here is like "hey bubba, why don't you bring on down some more of those fresh eggs for makin' some tasty treats?"  instead of "you know what i heard about the lastest production of sven: the musical? ...pass me another mimosa..."

different all together.
apples and oranges.

though i like all kinds of fruit.
um...
too many places to take that.

so what i'm saying is..despite how this is an orange when i would like to have another apple, the orange was filling, satisfying, and enjoyable.

wow.  i have no idea how i pulled that one together.  but can you see all the places that could have gone???

I feel compelled to write a review to lend some reality to the overall rating, as a public service. This place should be on Gordon Ramsay's "Kitchen Nightmares". Almost raw hamburgers (although ordered medium well). Chicken pasta made with Velveeta, and with little or no chicken. Run away.

I came here at 11 am on a Wednesday and was delightfully surprised! I live around the corner so I have been here before. I stopped coming here on the weekends because the wait is normally outrageous, but I learned today that it's a pleasant experience on weekdays! 

My order: 
I got "The Traditional". 
- Two Eggs over easy: These were done perfectly. They were still hot, which is much appreciated. Nothing is worse than cold eggs over easy.
- Seasoned Potatoes: These were good. I usually like my breakfast potatoes on the more well done side. These were less crispy than I would have ideally liked, but they still had some crispy edges. So I enjoyed them.
- Whole grain "artisan" toast: I laughed at the menu when it said "artisan" toast, being that this is a huge chain. But it really did not disappoint. The bread really elevated it from a normal, boring breakfast to a more delicious experience! Even if you don't like whole grain, I recommend this bread. Tasty. 
- Fruit: This is not part of "The Traditional", which normally comes with some type of meat. Our waitress was great and when I said "no meat", she offered this up instead. It was some melon, watermelon and pineapple. All fresh cut. 

Overall, I really enjoyed the experience! I don't drink coffee or anything like that, so I think my meal was 8-10$. Not that bad for a breakfast.

I will definitely return! There's nothing super unique about it but it was clean, bright, and the food was solid! I will only come on weekdays though when it is a stress-free ambiance. I also wouldn't wait more than 10/15 minutes to eat here, but I'll come back.
soild ice cream. sometimes go 3x a week - don't need to say much more than that!

I had the single worst meal of my life tonight. I ordered the Thai chicken dumpling broth bowl and it was 100% inedible!!!!! Made entirely of what seemed to be salted (and by salted I mean a whole shaker of salt) beef broth and soy sauce, I had to add three * the liquid with water. the chicken was HARD (what little there was), the vegetables were soggy and brown and the dumplings were dinky and tasteless! my daughters Mac and cheese was also the saltiest Mac n cheese Ever. Let ppl add salt if they want. 

The staff was also rude and slow. 

I know, I know, what did I expect from a sandwich place? You're right. But for 8.50, it better have SOME flavor or redeeming quality. Just awful. Panera, if you can't do it right, don't sell it!

The service here is incredible and the food is even better than that. We came to Cleveland Yelped an Indian restaurant - glad we picked this one. We came for lunch in a group of four. We ordered goat biriyani and Thali's. The food was incredibly flavorful and a great value. We are here for two days and will definitely be back tomorrow.
Superb service ..everything fresh and hard to find good restaurant near cleveland ...keep up good work

A group of friends and I (varying from 2 to 8 people) enjoy First Watch so much we make it our weekly breakfast spot and meet there every Sunday morning, a very busy time for the restaurant.  The service - no matter the server - is marvelous -- friendly, welcoming, attentive without hovering, and patient with us, since several of us have food allergies.  The food is always well-prepared, and the atmosphere is wonderful, with comfortable seating and ample booths. We  can actually hear each other at First Watch, despite the large crowd that appears regularly on Sunday mornings.  That's a big thing for us.  One important thing of note:  the employees all seem to genuinely like each other - and none of them hesitates for a moment to help the others out.  I'm a former restaurant critic and I take special note of that, because when the help doesn't get along, the customer experience heads downhill quickly. They actually seem to have fun working together, and that starts at the top.
Fabulous family and fabulous experience every time. The house salad dressing and bread are so tasty.

i just don't get this place.....what's the appeal???? crappy, overprice, average food, not far above a denny's or bob evans......egg crapes are disgusting, service non existant. GO TO A FAMILY STYLE JOINT.....this place just sucks!!!

I've been a huge fan ever since it opened.   Now living in Cincinnati, it is a shame there isn't one closer.  Where we now live, everyone really likes Graeter's which is also good, but noticed there is a lot more artificial flavourings, etc. added which Mitchell's does not.  Service is always very quick, so yes. please tip the kids who work hard at maintaing good service and keeping the facilities tidy.
